description:
I am sort of obsessed with this restaurant! I love food here and I can't even express how many times I have thought about this spot on regular day. I came here with friends from work because one lives around the corner and they have been here before especially ordering out. I love how many different currys options they have and even vegan options! I got Coconut Shrimp, which is coconut milk based curry with shrimp, so good! This perfect dish goes well with rice and their amazing naan! We got veggie appetizers and 3 different types of naan, some I don't know even know, but they all were very good and delicious! 

I came here twice so far and had absolutely wonderful time catching up with friends and eating their amazing curry. I absolutely have no complains about the food, it was fresh, delicious and not too pricy! Coming back soon for sure!
author: Galya T.

description:
Walked in around 2pm behind a family also coming in as they were sitting down, we were waiting at the door for the host but we were advised that the restaurant was closed. Went to another restaurant to eat and came back and saw through the window that another couple was seated eating their meal.  

Yelp said you were open....and i saw the customers eating...

..you mean to tell me that you were closed when we walked in but opened back up to serve those new customers after us?
author: Yerm I.

description:
Ended up here on a weekday evening with a friend. Got a table right away and the inside is pretty nice.

We ordered naan, saag paneer (palak paneer) and butter chicken (probably called murgh makhani on the menu). I didn't have a lot of expectations coming in but the food turned out to be quite nice. Naan was soft and both the dishes had the right taste, they could have much more flavor though.

I would only rate this 3.5 (with 3 being average and 4 being very good). It was good Indian food but barely above average. Not bad for a casual meal, it's pretty reasonably priced as well!
author: Vignesh B.

description: I wish I had the same positive experience with the food and service as others had. I ordered online at 2:44 they called to confirm the order at 2:51. The person said 45 minutes, I said no problem. I'm thinking ok off to a good start. At 3:54 I called to ask how much longer, was told 2-3 minutes. At 4:13 I called again, was told 2 minutes. Also expressed my concern the food may be cold, was reassured it wouldn't be. The order arrived at 4:20. The food was warm. I could forgive the slow delivery if the food was good. The Pulao rice was not "studded" with peas as described, the Murgh Masala (supposedly their specialty) was boring, and 2 tiny Gulab Jumun for $3.50. The garlic naan was good and the Navratan Korma was fair but far from good. Guess I keep going to the east bay for BEST Indian food.
author: Janine K.

description: I love Indian oven! Best daal soup! :) very relaxed and cozy atmosphere, great location too.
author: C J.

description: So delicious! We didn't over order, so the proportions were perfect. Authentic Indian waiters served us. Nice Indian music created nice ambience. The food wasn't too spicy. Delicious and flavorable.
author: Cole D.

description: Ordered from here on GrubHub and the food showed up 45 minutes late and when we called to check on the food no one would answer the phone. When the food did show up it was flavorless and the curry and sauces were extremely watery. Food was not hot, rice was undercooked, even the naan was cold and chewy. Very disappointing. Empty calories here, don't waste your stomach space on it.
author: Cecilie J.

description:
We went there twice, let's talk about the pros and cons:

pros: 
1. the Calamari Pakora is one of the most unique calamari we have tried, the batter is so special and so flavorful
2. Murgh Makhani is THE BEST INDIAN DISH EVER. just order one, get rice and get so many naan. 

cons:
1. the meat lover platter took forever even it is appetizer, and the lamb was raw.... it was pretty gross and really really not worth
2. onion naan was horrifying, it was 99% onion +1% actually naan. And the onion was so spicy...
author: Shuang W.

description:
Yummy. I like to go early. 4p. Then there is no line and the food comes out quick. Had the chicken vindaloo and it's spicy and hot AF. I love spice and hot so if u r in for a good sweat and a runny nose this is the dish for you. 
Been to India twice and this restaurant's flavors are just like if I would be eating in India.
Ps. The bathroom could be cleaner
author: Zita M.

description: We are out of town and ordered. When it arrived none of the dishes included rice and they didn't deliver napkins or silverware. So here we are stuck with basically sauces and no way to eat it. How is Indian food not include rice? I've never heard of that before. We assumed we were missing a bag of rice and silverware. I called and sure enough they just don't include rice. For $75 worth of food for 3 people, include the freakin rice.
author: Pamela B.

description:
This restaurant is way too crowded for a group of three or more very hard to sit and very loud parking is impossible
IMPORTANT...... restaurant claims to be handicap assessable I even called to reconfirm that but then was also told that the restaurants are not handicap assessable or wheelchair assessable looked at the restaurant with my own eyes and saw there was no way to take a wheelchair into the restaurant well in the wheelchair and The owner said well you can bring your wheelchair with you to the restaurant but you can't will in to the restaurant and still claim to be handicap assessable so I would avoid this restaurant for the fact that they claim to be handicap assessable and yet don't meet in the ADA requirements !!!!!!!
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Ordered Uber eats. Food was sub par at best. Flavorless tandoori chicken and sag paneer. Wish I would have cooked instead.
author: David M.

description:
I have been a happy diner at the San Francisco Indian Oven on
Fillmore.. Best to get there before it fills up as it can get a bit 
"chatty" 
I have never been disappointed by the perfect service and wonderful
Indian preparations.  There is lovely Indian music in the background instead of grunge rock like you get in some places.  
You will enjoy your evening there!
Dave A.
author: David A.

description:
If i could give this place zero stars, I would. I love the neighborhood, I want to spend money here, but these awful restaurants do not make it easy. Not only is the food mediocre at best, but the service is absolutely dismal. One can sit there for ten minutes, without even an acknowledgement from the staff. On one occasion, it was so ridiculous we left before even placing an order. Go anywhere else. The Thai spot next door is decent. Honestly, even if you waited in line for the over hyped ramen next door, you will probably be served faster. 


Please stop being awful. 

Your Indian food loving neighbors would really enjoy eating good Indian food in the neighborhood.
author: Alexandria W.

description: We ordered food one fine sunday afternoon and it was disappointing. We ordered Bombay chicken and Mattar mushroom. The food was cold and the quantity was very less. The chicken was old and cooked in a gravy that had nothing but water. The mushroom mattar had parts of mushroom that i had never seen before and as the chicken gravy was very watered down. The food had no taste and felt like it was made by someone who didn't give a shit about his job. Do yourself a favor and cook cos i bet it would be better than what you would get from this place
author: Satyajeet G.

description: Delivery was half an hour late and food was weak on every level. The rice was undercooked, sauces were runny and watery, and even naan was cold and flavorless. Portions were small and expensive for what they were.
author: Michael S.

description:
This WAS my Indian food go-to for the past 7+ years. 

I recently ordered delivery (like I frequently do) and told the person on the phone I was paying cash. The delivery man comes and I'm ready to pay, I'm owed $12 back. He says he doesn't have any change... who's problem is that? I would assume a delivery man would carry change. So we're arguing back and forth that he doesn't have change and he can't do anything and then has the audacity to say it is my responsibility. He gave me back $20 from me and left. He then calls me on my cell and tells me he wants me to come back down so he can give me change and I can pay for the total. I did. It's only right I pay for my food. I went downstairs and waited. He then said it would take 15min. I told him if this process takes too long then forget it....

Wtf am I doing? Waiting to pay for food from a delivery man that has no change whatsoever for me to pay what I owe and provide a tip? I told him forget it. After being disrespected and arguing with a delivery guy... this wasn't worth it. I went back upstairs and called it a day. I tried to pay! You can choke your little loss, while I lost time arguing with your employee. Not coming back.
author: Miss P.

description: Surprisingly bad. The chicken korma was thin and flavorless unlike any I've had before. Everything came with smaller portions than other restaurants and at slightly higher prices. This was some of the most bland, mediocre food I've ever had in this town. With so many other options I can't see any reason why I'd ever want to order from them again.
author: Mark S.

description:
3.5 STARS

I love having Indian food after a night of drinking. It's carby and comforting. On Saturday, January 9th, I decided to try Clay Oven on Haight for lunch. I placed my delivery order through delivery.com around 11:20pm. It arrived around 12:15pm.

Prices below are what I paid using delivery.com. Looking at their online menu, it looks like prices are a $1 higher per item, so I paid $4 more than ordering through their online system. I got a standard 10% off with delivery.com plus a 30% off coupon code, so it was worth it for me. Without any discounts, order through their site since it's cheaper.

*Vegetable samosa ($5.95): homemade crisp patties, stuffed with fresh potatoes and peas, served with homemade mint chutney and hot and sour tamarind chutney
*Chicken tikka masala ($13.95): clay oven roasted chicken in creamy sauce, spicy hot
*Garlic nan ($3.95): leavened bread stuffed with fresh garlic
*Onion kulcha ($3.95): nan stuffed with onion

The veggie samosas were crispy on the outside and soft inside. Good for dipping in the mint chutney or curry. The tikka masala was nice and creamy. I wish it were a little spicier as it didn't have much heat. I picked the highest spice level too. But the flavors were good. I liked the garlic nan. It was soft with a nice chew. Good garlic flavor. The onion kulcha was a little too oily, wet and doughy for me. Both where charred a tad too much, but I still a good vehicle for the curry. If you like rice, it's good to note the curry came with a side of rice.

Good option for Indian delivery. Just remember to order off their site and not delivery.com. You'll save yourself $1 per dish.
author: Elena N.

description: Have you ever had food that made you feel good? Just a bite of chicken tikka masala brings a smile to my face. I originally had a friend take me here as a treat. What a treat?! I have been treating myself at Indian Oven ever since. It's kind of pricey, but that may be because we always order way too much food. I just can't eat sensibly at this place. The service exceeds expectations. I went in yesterday for a "to go" order and while I waited for the food I was offered water three times (which I thankfully declined) and then finally a waiter brought me a delicious chai tea. Seriously, this is one of my favorites!
author: Stafford J.

description:
First time eating here and I was very happy with the food and service.

Generally speaking, a lot of indian places around town the food and it's spicing is pretty muddy, as though they've been cooked far too long, but not here. All of the dishes we ordered were brightly flavored, fresh and well balanced.

For example, the lamb vindaloo (my fave) and murgh makhani, the sauces were well put together with subtle yet complex flavor profiles. Their respective meats were well cooked and flavorful without being completely drowned and overtaken by the sauce. The same with the vegetable biryani, each vegetable was distinct and flavorful and the rice was fresh, well seasoned, and bright. It really seemed like well-loved home cooking.

Our waiter was very attentive and a consummate professional.

Had it not been for the kitchen staff loudly gossiping and several times dropping and kicking around stainless steel hotel pans--I literally couldn't even hear myself talking at the far side of the restaurant--i would give 5 stars.
author: Travin T.

description: The food was great so I couldn't believe it when I noticed the cook spit in the cooking area as he was cooking.  I finally worked up the courage to come back because the fish tikka masala was great but once again I noticed the chef spit something at the food he was cooking.  Unbelievable.
author: Mikey F.

description:
As far as Indian around or near Lower Haight goes, India Clay Oven is definitely my favorite. The prices are reasonable and the food isn't overly greasy. My go-tos are vegetable pakora, samosa, and Aloo gobhi. Everything is super flavorful and doesn't leave you feeling like you've made a bad choice. 

Bonus - they are open fairly late, which is a bit of a rarity in these parts.
author: Jon T.

description:
Great service and food. 
Cozy atmosphere with real Indian chefs who know what they are doing. You can taste it in the food!
author: Jason D.

description: Food was terrible, the curry separated and naan was chewy. Paneer curry reminded me of a Chinese dish. It was late and I was desperate. In retrospect I would have rather gone hungry.
author: Lydia G.

description:
Order delivery at 7pm. 
Eat at 8pm.
Burning stomach at 8:30pm.
Acid stomach at 8:41pm.
Taking 2 tums and Zantac at 9:00pm.
Pass out at 10pm...to the sounds of gurgling stomach.
Wake up at 2am , gotta go number 2.
Wake up at 4:30am , gotta go number 2.
6am..going number 2.
7am. Try to sleep a little before work.
8am shove ice cubes down my pants and head to work.
author: Rouz E.

description:
Very nice restaurant 
Lovely staff 
The food is amazing ! 
I love the tikka Masala :) with the goat cheese naan
author: Laura B.

description:
Been here 3 times now - the food always brings me back! This may be my favorite Indian place in the city. I always get the paneer makhani (butter paneer) and the garlic naan and they never disappoint! So buttery and flavorful. And the naan is deliciously garlicky and fluffy! Def my faves. You also get a complimentary papadom at the start - we got ours before we even ordered our entrees!

This time I also tried the fish tikka masala, which come with pretty large pieces of fish smothered in a beautifully red tikka masala sauce. It tasted pretty fresh, though we found a couple of large bones :(

Overall, really solid food, you won't be disappointed! Only downside is the long wait time for the food. We got there right at opening (11am on Saturday.. Not 9:45am!!) and were the only customers the entire time we were there. Yet we were there for about an hour - I think it took around 45 minutes for our main entrees to get served! Boo.

tl;dr food is AMAZING - worth the long wait time for food
author: Grace D.

description:
Great service and great food. Not the ordinary Indian cuisine. Not as salty and greasy. You can taste the curry/sauce was made with real spices instead of some cheap condiments. 
Definitely the best I've ever had. Will definitely come back and recommend.
author: Ou K.

description: The dinner was very disappointing. Matar paneer was under cooked. Paneer makhani had more salt than required. Chicken curry was okay. Breads were over cooked. Mango lassi was the only good thing in the dinner.
author: Priyank M.

description: The best Indian food in SF. I have tried every restaurant in the area. Indian oven is the place to go!
author: Aj C.

description:
Very sad that this place is not good. Whats up w all the *best of* reviews? 
Took forever to take our dine in order on an empty evening around 7p. Even water took forever. Food was not tasty. Brought me the wrong dish. I agree w other reviews that they care more for phone orders than in person dining. Be careful of chutney on the table - do not eat - you could get sick.
author: Gernaut A.

description:
I walked in and the server was immediately visibly annoyed by my presence. Maybe he thought it was weird that I'm eating alone at 3:17pm on a Saturday afternoon? He sat me at a table and walked away. When I asked for water he rolled his eyes and went to get water. I'm leaving this review before I even eat because the service is so awful. The people in the kitchen (which is open into to restaurant) have been loudly arguing with each other the entire time I've been here. 

Shitty experience. 

Update: the food is mediocre and they forgot to bring rice and mint chutney.

Apparently the owner saw this review and called the location while I was sitting there. I walked up to the counter to pay and the server kept trying to pass me the phone. I didn't feel like explaining myself to the owner. I just wanted to pay and get out of there. The server wouldn't take my money (that's cool I guess, but I wasn't trying to be cheap.)  he kept trying to get me to sit down and eat some free dessert but I was like let it goooo.he said "sorry for the terrible service". Glad he at least recognized that much.
author: Kyle C.

description: Went here for lunch and it was mediocre. We ordered palak paneer and aloo Gobi, both medium spicy. There was no spice at all and barely any flavor. The palak paneer had a weird consistency I've never had before. It tasted like it was over-puréed and was very bland. I was surprised to see all of their awards in the restaurant and was definitely let down.
author: Ashley C.

description: If you go here please do not order the squid salad. We did last night and it was not edible. They did at least deduct it from the bill when I said it was not edible and we were not going to pay for it. The rest of the food was mediocre at best and the waiter had a terrible attitude even before we said anything about the salad. They were busy with take out dinners which I suspect they do better with because it's harder for people to complain. We have been going here off and on since the 80s and were reminiscing about how great it used to be but we will not be going back.
author: Caroline S.

description: Ordered 2 chicken tikka masala dishes for delivery tonight. The chicken was delicious, but was shocked to see we received no rice with our dish!  Rice has always been included when ordering from other places, why not from here?  Bummed that I ended up having to make my own rice to go with my chicken. Really disappointed about this!
author: Heidi M.

description: Just got delivery. Super quick and delicious. As mostly a vegetarian, I've tried many Indian spots and this place always has a lot of veggies in their dishes. Not all sauce. My new go to for delivery
author: Fulton B.

description: Be warned! We ordered delivery from Indian Oven and got food poisoning. We both had the same dishes, and were both up all night with stomach pains, etc. This morning I looked up their Health Dept Score. A score of 86-90 is 'adequate' and a score of 70 or below is 'poor'. They have a 65.
author: J.D. W.

description: Worse indian food of the bay area, i have been to many Indian food places around the bay area, havent had any worse food than this place. Never ever even try to order chicken biryani at all.
author: Ramesh C.

description: 1 of the best chicken tikka masala in San Francisco great costumer service everyone looks professional, so far this is my favorite place to eat
author: Taha R.

description:
I used to live in the neighborhood and loved eating here.  But now that I am on the other side of town, Indian Oven has become our go to delivery option for Indian food.

We have tried a TON of delivery options, and this place is consistently the best Indian food we can get delivered.
author: Amjad S.

description: Really overpriced for small portions. I'd let it slide if it was decent but it was below average in taste.
author: Henry T.

description:
This was a really, really average meal. Which disappointed me a lot as before you go in, you can hardly get in the door with all the different awards they're supposed to be rocking!

Put it this way -  I lived in India for 6 months and although I never expect places to capture all the flavours, I really did struggle to wonder if they put in any spices that you would usually get in any normal curry. Living in Manchester UK, where we literally have hundreds of Indian restaurants - I can't think of one which has offered up something this bland. 

I ordered the Mango lassi and Paneer Jalfrezi - and asked for it spicy but unfortunately it didn't come with any hint of a kick. The lassi was tasty but the chapati and garlic naan I ordered on the side were dry and not nice to eat. For $30 with a tip it felt like a missed meal opportunity on my part...

An extra star because the staff were nice and friendly and the restaurant looks quite nice.
author: Jonny Q.

description: I have a real thing for this place since 1994. Love...papadums,tandoori chicken skewers,spinach...saag. mmmmmmm. Dal soup is good as is chicken tikka masala.white table cloths,red roses,expensive..so eat in restraunt.
author: Christina M.

description: Great little local joint! I've walked past this place so many times now and it's been on my list to try. It didn't disappoint! The food was really yummy, cheap and quick!!! Bonus - we got 50% off our second main meal and they serve non-alcoholic beers. Great place for take out too.
author: Faith S.

description:
I am not a big fan of Indian food, partly because I am not used to the spices used in Indian cuisine and because I don't like cilantro.

This being said, my friends ordered from Indian Oven on a Friday night and I shared the saag mushroom. It was delicious! I found my go-to dish when I go for Indian food!
I also tried the chicken masala which was really good.
Skip the spinach paratha though.

I will definitely re-order or go there!
author: Coralie S.

description:
We got the paneer makhani to go. Felt that it was overpriced, given that it had paneer instead of meat, like the other dishes. Not sure if the cashier was having a bad day, but the restaurant had only just opened for dinner, and she was already sporting the world's worst attitude/angry face. Even though our order was to go, we had to specifically ask for utensils/napkins (we were planning on a mini picnic at the park nearby). It took the staff a lot of time searching and waiting (staff were blocking each other's way in small conversation clusters) to come up with the utensils/napkins.

The horrible service and mediocre food (super watery with few pieces of paneer, see picture), we'll never be coming back.
author: Chia-Fen Y.

description: Absolutely amazing! I've noticed how other restaurants focus on the sauce and not the quality of the meat. They focused on both sauce and meat. I WILL be returning for my butter chicken needs.
author: Daoud M.

description: Favorite Indian food in SF. I have been going here for 10 years and it's always been delicious. Favorites are the classic chicken tikka masala and navratan korma.
author: Kristen K.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE. Two of us got sick. My paneer makhni was medicinal like someone had knocked a bottle of spices into it--I threw up. The other dishes we ordered, saag paneer, saag gosht, and chicken tikka masala were all spicy despite having asked for them to be mild. Service was AWFUL! They denied the food was bad (it was just plainly messed up!) and nickel and dimed us.
author: Marz C.

description: No. Do NOT even bother. I live around the corner and came in on a quiet night alone to eat. I walked in and was seated. There were 5 other patrons and 9 people working. They paid zero attention to me. After 15 minutes I left. I feel foolish for even waiting that long. Wait in line for Iza next door, well worth the wait. I've eaten here several times before and the food is mediocre at best anyway. If you really want great Indian take an 8 minute walk towards the Mission and try Pakwan, it's delicious!
author: Louis G.

description: Service was slow.  Food was okay. Not that great but okay.  Not as flavorful as I would expect.
author: D R.

description:
Place was great. Top food and reasonable prices. Guys who run it are nice too. 

Meal for 2 is enough for 3! 

Highly recommend
author: Dan K.

description:
What a great restaurant! We ordered saag paneer for the table, and it was p-e-r-errfect. They also have $4 Lagunitas IPAs, and Sonoma County wine for cheepz, so yeah. Pretty bomb Indian spot. Yummers. 

P.S. Pinder was attentive af. Great server!
author: Brandon C.

description:
Group lunch here: food took forever to order and come out- I noticed few delivery ordered taken care of before us though we've been seated for a while. We were the only group at the restaurant.

Vegetable samosa- most bland I've ever had. Need more spices.

Chicken tiki masala 3.5/5

Vegetables with rice- 2/5- super salty

Onion naan- under cooked

Calamari pakora- 4/5 

Dol lentils 3.5/5 - seasoned with hint of spicy

Mango lassi- 2/5 couldn't taste the mango and it had a hint of garlic

Wouldn't come back here
author: Vanae W.

description: This was my first time in this Indian restaurant and it was a wonderful experience. The guys here are good. The service is also very quick. I ordered Murgh Masala and it was delicious, the spices were perfect with sauce. I really enjoyed my dinner here. Beautiful music atmosphere and hospitality.
author: Vikram R.

description: I ordered for delivery from Indian Oven today.  The biryani was awful, as was the murgh makhani.  I used to love this place in the past, but apparently things have changed.
author: Bret T.

description: Waiter came to our table 15 mins later, was not so busy. We four guys ordered one Punjabi fried rice, chicken pakora,chicken Biriyani,chicken madras , and something called Bombay chicken like curry with white rice. All those Rice's were spoiled. Like 3 to 4 days old. We asked the waiter that we want to talk to the chef . He said he doesn't know English. But the waiter was trying to be very smart like he knows about everything about the food. Since we guys are a restaurant manager & chefs. We know how to Cooke food . One of my friend spit the white rice as it was spoiled. No one was ready to replace the food or cancel those orders. We Ordered beers and wine , so we decided to step out. Don't spoil Indian name don't act too smart the waiter thinking like Amir khan . Respect the guest. It's also like racism Why you like only american. You have to learn more ....  respect each and every customer please...
author: Sathish G.

description: i've gotten sick from the food. tried again and gotten sick again. clean your kitchen!
author: Jim M.

description: Absolutely AWFUL service. Everyone there did not seem to know how to smile, we felt they were angry at us the entire time as they were rude and barely spoke to us much less checked if we needed anything. It also took forever to get our food or order drinks. Was not a pleasant experience and will not be returning.
author: Briana H.

description:
Don't. Request. Delivery.

The beautiful idea about delivery is that you expect to pay for the convenience of food being delivered on time and food tasting as if you were sitting right in the restaurant; except you'd enjoying the dinner in front of friends, family, or in front of a TV for the solo nights. 

Apparently, Clay Oven fails in this simple request. A business they chose to be in which I had hoped delivered good food. I made a mistake of choosing a restaurant that was closer to home "thinking" it would be here quicker; big mistake. 

Food arrived over an hour and 15 minutes later - luke-warm to cold; ordered soup and biryani dish; no brainer for the restaurant. I quickly contacted the restaurant and stated if we paid a fairly good amount for food it should be hot and ready to enjoy; excuse was one their driver was caught in traffic; and two they were having car problems. Who's problem is this? 

It's unfortunate that I have to make a critique on their business model rather than their food. I don't recommend ordering from them for delivery. This is an epic fail and hope they find a way to either NOT offer delivery or close business. Simple as that. Next.
author: Edgar M.

description: The food here was amazing. The butter chicken and masala chai were perfect. Highly recommended!!!
author: Chris D.

description:
My girlfriend and I are Indian food fanatics. We typically frequent another Indian place off of Divis, but walked along the lower haight and decided to eat here tonight.

I've had their takeout before and it's typically good, but tonight was especially delicious. We shared a chicken vindaloo and a handful of other appetizers (hint: get the mulletagawny soup, it's fabulous). 

Also, how can you complain when the drinks are cheap and the portions are aplenty? We got so much out of only one entree that we got some extra rice to make lunch for the two of us tomorrow. 

Awesome!
author: Kian L.

description: This place is really good. The service is great, the food comes out fast, and they're very accommodating. Lots of menu selections and a good amount of vegetarian choices as well. Will come back for sure.
author: Nathan O.

description: Its a good and simple restaurent. I went there last night with my friend to have dinner. He was also a vegetarian so his options were limited, yet they had a full page of vegeterian entrees on their menu. We ordered the vegetable samosas as apetizers. They were really good, hot and fresh. As for entree, i ordered the chichen Tika masala. I ordered rice and plain naan with it. The entree was delicious as well. The tika was hot and it exceeded my expectations. Im not big on spicy food and the chicken tika was the best option. In addition, the server made sure to fill our glass of water fast whenever we'd finish it. Overall good experience, i will definitely be coming back to eat more at Indian Oven. I would recommend it to anyone who is big on Indian food like myself
author: Jaafar L.

description: I have been ordering from them for years and the food is amazing. The service is wonderful, there are so many delicious items to order from. The meat is quality and the sauces are authentic and delicious. When I have visited the restaurant in person, the service was outstanding as well.
author: Emily W.

description:
I've ordered from here several times before but never went inside the actual restaurant until today. The interior design could be a bit better. There's this awkward wall thing when you walk in and no stand for a hostess. Like is it supposed to be a bullet-proof wall? Why does it exist? There is also a wilting rose on each table. Is it symbolic of curry love? I wonder. 

We ordered the chicken tikka masala, samoas, and gobi aloo (cauliflower/ potato dish). They were really good. I'm such a fan of their chicken tikka masala with naan; I have cravings for it sometimes. It could be a bit warmer. Good service, may or may not come again. The future awaits.
author: Juliana P.

description: This is one of the (one because I have not eaten at all Indian restaurants in SF) best Indian food places! Best chicken vindaloo! Meat always tender not rubbery. Solid white meat. The Pakora is also delicious! Crunchy fresh and they always deliver in 40 minutes or less depending...
author: Legion S.

description:
Delicious meal for a date night! Lamb was tender and perfect! Garlic naan and chai were perfect as well! 

Our vegetable dish had a few less veggies than normal, so they quickly remade it. They also comped us coconut ice cream for dessert, for the "trouble" - which was not an issue to start with. Excellent customer service.
author: Coral T.

description:
I used to love this place but just ate here and my meal was shockingly BLAND. Did they use any spices at all? I'm not sure. Or maybe they watered it down to save money. 

The whole point of going to an Indian restaurant is to eat spicy food, so this was a waste. But if you like bland Indian food, this is your place.

Now I'm in the back seat writing this review while my friends try to figure out how this happened and how confused they are about the experience.

This place is going down. I'll never go back.
author: Rose B.

description: This is one of the worst Indian restaurant I have ever been to I was visiting from Chicago I'm Origin from India so I know my Indian food I would never recommend anyone to try this place the Service and the food was bad we ordered our food and the guy was only bringing on dish at a time and that was also wrong stuff my wife had ordered some pulav rice and the guy brings  us plain rice and we told the guy that this is not pulav and he kept on telling me no no this is pulav then finally I showed him the Manu and he agreed with me by the time he brought the pulav other food was already to cold to eat anyway to make long story short I don't recommend this place to anyone it was just a waste of money
author: bharat t.

description: This is my first Indian restaurant that has Chilean Sea Bass. The Fish Masala was delicious.
author: Bret A.

description: Best lamb curry in town.  Great service too!  I also like the tikka Masala.  Great selection and good prices.
author: Robin L.

description:
Waited 50 minutes for our food after we ordered it. Stressful, anxiety-inducing atmosphere as the servers rushed around busy with everything except providing good service. Water refills were rare and when they happened, the server filled the glass up about one-third of the way.

When the food finally came we ate a little before deciding to get it packed up to go to get out of there. The server took the food to box it up and put the bottom of the basket of naan IN one of our other dishes. When they returned with our to-go bag, they set the bag in food that had spilled on the table. They had also thrown out our remaining naan instead of boxing it up with the rest of our food.

The food wasn't terrible, but this was overshadowed by everything else about the night.
author: Megan M.

description:
LOVE!! Awesome service and amazing food.
A great local spot for a week night dinner. 
Not crazy packed, with long ass lines.
Order the Bombay chicken!!
author: Christie S.

description:
Indian Oven is our quintessential carry-out place. And that's the highest compliment I can give.  No joke. After a wonderful long trip from Italy, the first thing my Indian family wanted to do after landing was grab some food from Indian Over and continue our slumber of Italian vacation. 

The staff here knows you and as soon as you call them and or leave your order online, you get a confirmation of your order. The staff here is always very attentive and treated us with complimentary dessert more often than not. Just the best. Let's talk about food now. 

1. Malai Kofta: Always order spicy malai kofta. This is my family's favorite. Tender softness of kofta combined with hot yet sweet mix of curry sets the mood for dinner. This is not your run of the meal dinner. It is a dinner infused with flavor of balanced spices and straight up deliciousness. 

2. OKRA!!!: Seriously order the Okra. Don't doubt that recommendation. Order it very spicy. This is the jam. If you like okra at all (note okra is difficult to make), this is going to hit every note you can expect with okra. If you can't handle hot food, still order it hot. Just get a side of yogurt with it and enjoy this moment. 

3. Biryani: I am confident my family only comes visits me in the city for this biryani. Note my family lives in the east bay which has really good Indian food, and yet they trek over here for this biryani. The rice is not dry nor mushy. It is cooked just right and flavored in the most balanced approach. 

Can't say enough...
author: swati k.

description:
I've been here several times and this time had to be one of the best!

My friend and I were provided with excellent customer service by a superior waitstaff and the chef cooked us delicious food that was seasoned perfectly.

Upon walking through the door we were greeted and seated right away. The manager gave us a friendly smile and the servers filled our waters and place menus on our table fast as lighting.  

I requested fresh lemon wedges for my water in those also came very fast.

There's a lot of tasty dishes to choose from on this menu but we narrowed our selection down to:

EATS:

Papadum- delicious and authentic $2

Boti Kebob- Hot and Tender spiced with a delicious dry Indian rub $16.95

Punjabi Hot Fish Curry- super spicy and delicious tender Chilean Sea Bass $15.95

Chicken Tikka Masala- the Masala sauce was creamy and rich and delicious 

2 orders of Pulao Basmati rice- steamed well and peas on top, good for soaking up the Masala Sauce  :) $3.95 each

DRINKS:

Water w/ fresh lemon - never had to ask for a refill, the servers were on top of their game for sure!

Indian Oven is an upscale Indian Restaurant with a friendly staff and great food.  Good for dates- good for friends- good for takeout- nothing bad to say!  5 stars.  Thanks Indian Oven. 

I left satisfied, full and happy!  Thanks Indian Oven. You made my night.
author: Justin G.

description:
I'm updating this because even though it's a little pricier for takeout (however, the restaurant IS nicer than most in the area if you're dining in), and it's now pretty far from my apt (I used to live 2 blocks away, and now I live by Baker Beach), it is still worth the freaking drive to that delicious chicken korma. It's.so.good. And I know it's so good because I have eaten sooo much more indian food in the past 4 years and it's still at the tip-top of my list. 

Order FTW:
Papadams
Mango Chutney
Chicken Korma
Chicken Tikka Masala
Regular Naan
Rice

You're welcome.
author: Nikki D.

description: One of my favorite places to get really nice comfort food level Indian cuisine. The restaurant is well decorated, the service is incredible. Overall I enjoyed the food very much. Would definitely come here more often.
author: Tan D.

description:
Great food and great service. 
I'd recommend this place to whoever is in the mood for Indian food and is in the area.
author: Jaspar S.

description: The delivery service was FAST! Best saag paneer I've had in a while. Coconut veggies was delicious.
author: Irene D.

description: Possibly the worst Indian food I've eaten in years. The food I ordered was not cooked by a South Asian. The sheekh kebabs were tasteless and overdone. The dal was watery and almost inedible. The Rogan Josh and Panner Mattar were just plain awful. A complete waste of money. Give your spare cash to the homeless instead of spending it at Indian Oven.
author: Mahesh A.

description:
I'm not really sure what to rate this place because we've had good food and we've had not so good food delivered. My boyfriend loves their chicken tikka masala, but I'm not 100% sold on the saag paneer (my go to at all Indian restaurants). 

So far the best place we've found that delivers in the Sunset, but not the best food I've had in the city.
author: Daphne W.

description: Very tasty food & friendly staff. It is clean and has beautiful paintings on the walls & Indian music playing softly in the background which is appreciated. The mango lassi was nicely balanced and not overly sweet like most places. The Kheer was not overly sweet which is appreciated. The chicken tikka masala was very good. The only thing I didn't like was that the naans were a soft & doughy inside. I thought longer baking time would do them good!
author: Daniel B.

description: Went here for a quick bite before heading back to work. Since I was the only one in the restaurant at 4:30PM, service was lickity quick.  chicken makhini was creamy and well seasoned. Can't wait to go back.
author: Robert C.

description: One of the best Indian spots in the city. Judging from the chicken tikka masala, these guys do it right. The chicken tikka masala is creamy and so flavorful! Plus the chicken is tender. I've also tried the Prawns korma, and WOW it's good. The sauce is even creamier, it's my new go-to dish.
author: Raniel C.

description:
This used to be my go-to place for tasty, flavorful Indian food in the Haight/hayes area. The food used to authentically spiced and full of bold flavors that brought memories of being back in a roadside restaurant in Punjab or Delhi. 

However, something has changed in the last few months. I ordered a Murgh Makhani (which I always do) with a Kabuli and a paneer naan along with two samosas for appetizers. 

The samosas were tough to break into like they had been made and frozen for a while. Samosa shells are supposed to be soft and flakey. The potato stuffing inside also lacked flavor and tasted bland.

But the biggest disappointment was the main course - the murgh makhani (or butter chicken) was absolutely flavorless. No hint of salt, seasoning, spice.. The naan's were very bready and didn't have the crispness in them. 

I don't know what happened to this place and how it went from being the most flavorful  Punjabi food to being below mediocre.

It's such a shame, I hope they bounce back.
author: Nadeem K.

description: I was quite disappointed with my experience at this restaurant. I ordered chicken biryani. The server brought the Biryani with no accompaniment of the usual yogurt or Raita. I had to ask him to bring it. Then I ordered tea, the server brought the tea spilling over the cup everywhere. I had to request him to bring it to me in a clean cup. I don't like the Biryani, the tea was good. But after I left the place, I had a stomach upset even with the very small portion of the un-delectable Biryani I had.  So good is a one star and so is service.
author: Nimi A.

description: Our favorite Indian in San Francisco. The lamb pasanda is awesome, the chicken masala is the best! Try it with some naan.
author: Simon F.

description: Excellent lunch of chicken tikka masala and saag paneer! Fast and friendly service that was accommodating to a baby & stroller. Mango lassi was delicious, too.
author: Nicki K.

description: Great Indian in my hood. The people are really friendly and fun. . . especially Shan!
author: Adonica W.

description: Great food - but found a 1/3 inch shard of glass in my food. Definitely do not advise eating here.
author: Hannah K.

description: This was the first time I feel like homely. Great service. Especially the one on front desk. The best of Bay Area.
author: Chenna R.

description: Really great option in the area for Indian food. The service is efficient and friendly, and I've always gone early but the place seems kinda under-rated, especially for the area.
author: Nina N.

description:
Came to try this place out for the first time. Ordered their Chkn vindaloo, garlic naan and a side of rice. Even though they seemed to have forgotten my pick-up order they were pretty fast to get the food out.

Food portions were decent, but they don't match the price for the plate. I ALSO FOUND PLASTIC WRAPPING IN MY FOOD. Not what I like to pay for.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I love Indian food, but it this place had no flavor! I asked for spicy and one dish not spicy and I couldn't tell the difference. Also the naan was so oily it caused a huge mess. 

Don't sit next to the window the fruit flies have created a home there. I won't be coming back.
author: Ahmad H.

description:
So... My boyfriend and I have been going here for the past few months. Here is our take on it. When we first came here the food was amazing. Great flavors and amazing quality food.

However. These past three times we've gone we have both gotten very VERY sick. I don't know what has happened here but I am truly concerned with the 'quality' of the food. 

In addition, last time we went we specifically asked for salmon tikka masala. We clarified this 3 or 4 times and were assured this is what we were getting. We got home and jokes on us. Again terrible white fish. 

Idk. 50$ for 2 dishes? Really?
author: Lara S.

description: Had take out from here and wasn't very impressed with the quality. The chicken tikka masala was runny and not very flavorful, the chicken was also kind of dry.
author: Amr N.

description: Unfortunately creating a Yelp account to express a recent frustration at this restaurant. I have been here a few times before. The service can be a little long (even if the restaurant is close to empty) and the food is usually descent. This time, I noticed that my glass had lip stains and asked if it could be replaced. This must have irritated them, because the food turned out to be particularly worse than it's ever been. Naan was cold, chicken was overcooked and sauce was extremely watered down and nearly tasteless. It was honestly disappointing, and I won't be returning or recommending this restaurant.
author: Amber H.

description:
UPDATE!
We went to Indian Oven last night for a family birthday.
It was a good experience, as usual, the food is good, the staff is very nice and the price is right.
The reason I'm updating my first review is that finally they added a woman to their staff! 
She was our waitress and she did an excellent job, accommodating our large group and helping us with the cake/happy birthday moment.
Indian Oven is definitely our choice for a warm, cozy atmosphere, delicious food and nice staff.
author: Amira T.

description:
If you crave for Indian cuisine, there is a lot better Indian restaurants in the city, and my suggestion is that you spend your money somewhere else, and avoid this place. 

Wow, i don't know where to start, i went there for lunch party of two, around 3pm, there was nobody at the restaurant, even tho they are open from 10AM, they where clearly not ready to serve guests,  i had one of the worst services ever, waiter was not professional, he had very poor hygiene dirty apron and uniform, plates where dirty as well and the silverware. 
It took over 30 - 45 minutes to get our entrees, we where very close to leave. Meanwhile they had they vendors doing delivery and make so much noise it was very unpleasant. 
Food is below average, chicken tandoori was not seasoned or marinated properly, naan was very oily and not cooked! ,
author: Nenad M.

description: Some of the food was charred and burnt and tasted bitter I don't think I will be ordering here again
author: Raymond W.

description: The food here is as good as it gets. I took my boss there for dinner. Her first time. Pinder, our waiter, was very helpful selecting the food. When we needed water, we got it...which helped! We had three dishes: a lamb curry (HEAVEN!) some vegetarian thing with eggplant (very good) and tandoori chicken (THE BEST). I recommend this place highly. Ask to sit in Pinder's section!
author: George K.

description: Came in on a Sunday afternoon. It was super quiet which was great! Fast and great service, tasty and satisfying curry, and decent portions. I think the curry tasted different than the last time we came here, but was still
author: Cho S.

description:
This is not the same restaurant I wrote about....it was sold name and all to Indian Clay Oven whose business was failing at the corner of Haight & Fillmore.

Now this place is failing. Its awful. Ordered Daal soup, nasty nasty nasty. Yellow murky water with some lentils occasionally drifting past your spoon. Nasty...did I say that? 

My friends meal, the fish sat under the heat lamp until it was greasy and cold. 

I would not eat here again.
author: Marz W.

description: I am updating my review. We went there today for lunch. The floors are filthy. I mean filthy... So much so that we slipped twice trying to get to the bathroom. The waiter says "sir please go upstairs and use the bathroom upstairs". I follow his advice. I will spare you the graphical details but I've seen better in public bathrooms in India. Food also went south. Chicken tikka masala was too creamy and tandoori chicken was too dry. Something went drastically wrong here.
author: bora o.

description:
Addicted to the chicken korma!
This has been my go to Indian restaurant for years. 
Great for larger groups in the back dining room.
Parking can be a problem but well worth the drive around the neighborhood to find parking.
author: Melody M.

description:
The food is just okay but the waiters uniform was extremely dirty and smelly. We asked for our food to go because we couldn't handle his stinky smell. 
We told the nice owner about the waiter. He sent him home and the owner served our dinner instead.  
It has gone down but the owner is super sweet and it makes a different. I wish him LUCK with the business.
author: Cathy B.

description: this place was VERY good! Got the chicken tikka masala! So good:) very flavorful! The workers were very friendly,refilled drinks frequently, and were very tentative to our needs! Would definitely recommend coming here:)
author: Sarina J.

description: Good prices. Great service. Great food. I almost forgot to leave a review but after going to Five Rivers Indian Food in Daly City, this place seemed stellar. The waiter was so friendly, helped us with chutnies, food was good and timely. One little drawback was that the middle of the samosa was cool. Definitely going back, though.
author: L L.

description: Had some vegetable samosas and papad. Both were great. Look forward to coming back for a full dinner. Could improve on speed of service, but food looks solid.
author: Ravi R.

description: The food was good but the service was unbelievably slow, and not very good. First of all, they did not give us our menus for about 10 minutes. I think they all thought maybe that we had already ordered. We ordered our food and it took like 30-40 minutes to come. We asked for our bill 3 times. Idk how it was miscommunicated but we didn't get the bill until we finally walked up to the waiter and basically waited for him to print it for us. I'm actually typing this while waiting for them to come by and take the credit card... Hopefully we make it out!
author: Sophie Z.

description:
"Meh" is right.  I mean, I'm just being honest.   The pakoras were alright but literally every other dish we got I have had better.  The saag paneer (kind of the test of an Indian restaurant, right?)  was so bland, practically flavorless.  It had a total of five pieces of paneer, also. The chana masala was waaay too spicy and hardly masala-ish.  And the dahl soup?  Boring. 

Will not be ordering from here again, sorry to say.

UPDATE--So, this is weird (and slightly creepy). Literally hours after writing my review, I got a phone call from an unknown number that I did not answer. A few minutes after that, I got a long text from the same number, from someone from Indian Oven asking me to remove my review and promising to give me good food in the future. Very bizarre. If my review says I was not satisfied with the food, why would I want more??  

What happened to you, Indian Oven?  You used to be a favorite?  Please don't call or text me again.
author: Radha K.

description:
Used to be THE best indian restaurant in the city for years I went there very week. But then they sold it to the restaurant across the street and the food got really bad. I won't tell you about our attempts to eat there. I will -never- eat there again.

The chef who made the original, award-winning Indian Oven menu and set the tone for this food for almost 15 years now has his own restaurant called Aslam's Rasoi out in the Mission. Easily the best indian food in SF.
author: Jeff C.

description: In the afternoon there's tons of seating and it's very quiet compared to the cafés nearby. Unlimited chai makes them a way better deal than getting coffee. Also, if I'm hungry, I'd prefer a samosa to a croissant. The server is very gracious and didn't mind at all (that I wasn't ordering a full meal). I didn't ask for their wifi and I don't know whether they have any: this is good b/c it makes it easier to focus on writing. I go pretty often, and for dinner too :)
author: David T.

description: Fifty minutes to get our food in an empty restaurant with tons of takeout going out the door. When we said something it was clear that they had forgotten our order entirely. The food that finally came out was tough and the rice clumpy and cold. What a bummer.
author: Dave H.

description:
I just spent $100 on the worst lunch!  I would never identify this food as "Indian".. Could have been any type of food served with Naan n samosas. No spice at all, no tandoori rub, no good Indian food. The mushrooms were submerged in oil, the saag with no flavor and the tandoori fish with no tandoori flavor.
 I've been to India and lived in SF for 30 years...this is no Indian restaurant. But if you're new to town and have never tried any other cuisine beyond KFC? You might like it.
author: M L.

description: This place was one of the first places I have ever been to. The food was so bad, my dog could honestly make better food. Their lentils were so trash, very uncooked. I would give this place a zero star if I could. If you're planning on going to this place, please think twice. Many reviews are bad and I agree with them very deeply. Worst food, it is very bad.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Ordered through eat24 which stated 45-60 min.  After 70 min I contacted eat24 and immediately got a call from the delivery guy who said he was just leaving the restaurant.  Food arrived at about 90 min.  The delivery guy apologized and said they were really busy. 

The food was cold and especially the Naan and rice seemed like they had been sitting out for a long time. 

The portions seemed small for the price, and the flavors were decent, but not special.
author: Ronan L.

description:
Ordered delivery from this place - samosas, two chicken dishes and naan. Overall this was sub-mediocre Indian food, with only the samosas meeting the "passable" bar. 

Our biggest complaint is that both the chicken dishes tasted like plastic, as if they'd dissolved some of the take-out containers they came in. Even if we were to ignore that, the flavor level was severely lacking as if they'd forgotten to add the usual spices you would find in these dishes. Finally the naan was coated in what looked like artificial butter...not inspiring. 

If you do decide to order from here, just note that entrees don't automatically come with rice (or else they forgot it in our order...)
author: Yuting L.

description:
Been going there for years but just getting around to reviewing (sorry).

Really good Indian food, reasonably priced, good service, cool neighborhood.  Small wonder they've lasted all these years.
author: Paul M.

description: Mediocre food and always late on delivery...kudos for delivering to treasure island though. Their chicken tikka masala is better than most but the kabuli naan I think has too much coconut.
author: Berna V.

description:
I avoided writing a review here for a long time. In San Francisco, once people find a good restaurant, it's ruined by long waits. But, Indian Oven deserves it.

Indian Oven has apparently been around for almost thirty years, which should tell you something. Restaurants in the Lower Haight measure their lifespans in months. Somehow, this place has been kept secret. Well, come on down. I'm willing to share.

Get Tandoori anything. You'll be so happy. And be nice to Norman, maybe you'll get a free beer while you wait! :-)
author: Michael B.

description:
What have you become, India Oven? This oven's flame is out!

This used to be my favorite Indian restaurants. I used to dream of their lamb korma.

These last few years have seen a steady decline. Today, we decided to try them in hopes that they improved. It was barely edible. 

The meat was tough and bad quality. It was completely bland with no flavor at all. They even managed to screw up the naan by making it way to dry and burned. 

Wishing for the old management back!
author: B D.

description: Absolutely fantastic food, excellent wait staff. The lamb gosht is fabulous, definitely a must order. They treated us so well, and hooked us up with rice pudding for dessert, free of charge. I'll DEFINITELY be back!!
author: Alex K.

description: Order this for delivery tonight and it was one of the worst Indian food I ever had. The Dal soup was so bland that I felt like I was drinking salt water. The mushroom matter was also very bad! Tasted like the mushroom was thrown in at the last minute. Did not blend with the sauce at all. Will not be eating here again.
author: Hai P.

description: Don't try using a coupon or restaurant.com pass here.  Even though it is endorsed from the restaurant they won't take it, even if you paid for it on restaurant.com.  The owner got in a 30 minute argument with me which led to him cursing me out the door, but hey got a free meal out of it, so maybe try it? ;)
author: Sameer B.

description: First came here end of 2015 for a dinner party - food was superb. What really made me feel compelled to share today though is their fantastic service. I came by late last night just before they closed, hoping to find a dessert for my friend's birthday celebration at a bar nearby. The waiter was friendly, patient, and extremely helpful. He made great suggestions on which dessert to pick and gave me a candle. Will be back for dinner again soon!
author: Elisa C.

description:
This place was awesome! We actually ordered it on grub hub and didn't expect much... But instead we found a new fave!

:)
author: J W.

description: Really delicious food. Had the chicken tikka masala, dal, veggie samosas and garlic naan. Strong recommend! Tender chicken and well spiced dal! I'll definitely come back here.
author: Katie F.

description: Chicken briyani and chicken tikka masala were delicious! We also had the aloo paratha but that was lacking flavor. Do not get that! Otherwise, I felt the food was really good and service was great.
author: Samantha S.

description: Love the food and the place was small and cozy. Vegetable samosa was delectable. The Goat cheese Naan was my favorite.
author: Michelle M.

description: Ordered delivery. The portions are on the smaller side for being pretty expensive and don't come with rice. I got the chicken masala. The chicken came in huge pieces and was a little dry. The sauce was pretty tasty. Not completely sold yet, but would give it another try.
author: Jeffrey G.

description:
Indian Oven is an exceptional east Indian restaurant.

I'm one of those people that doesn't generally like Indian food.  I don't ever chose it.  When friends suggest it, I may sound polite on the phone, but one big giant eye roll occurs on the other end of the phone that they can't see.

Indian Oven totally exceeded all expectations.  The atmosphere in the restaurant is beautiful with nicely painted murals on the walls and it is really clean.  The staff is attentive and pleasant.

But, best of all, was the food.  I was stunned to be throwing down all kinds of Indian food with pure abandon.  Everything was insanely delicious.  The samosas were amazing.  The chicken we ordered was out of this world.  The two sauces they bring to the table--one mint and another some yummy sweet/spicy red wonder--were fabulous.  I wanted to just keep eating, and eating, and eating.  

If you would like excellent, crisp and enjoyable Indian food, come here!  I loved it!  

I FINALLY 100% enjoyed Indian cuisine at this restaurant.

And I WILL be back!
author: Marya G.

description:
On the phone they said they could care less and don't need me as a patron when I asked why they couldn't find the cross streets.  Called another place, had speedy delivery and found the place just fine.

Wouldn't know what their food tastes like.  NEVER SHOWED UP!  Gave a mobile number, address and simple instructions. Condo is on the corner of cross streets.  Called their driver AND their place of business and stood out on the corner for 10 minutes when they said they couldn't find it.

Update: They did call either after reading this or when their driver returned with my food and wanted to send it out again.....not sure what that means.
author: Jaiden F.

description:
This place is a solid 4 stars. 

I've come to this place many times over the last 4 years. The food is always delicious, the service is not always warm, but if there's ever an issue they are quick to make sure the customer is happy. 

Yes there are better Indian good spots in the city but Indian oven is a great neighborhood standard. It's a good place for a date, the food has never let me down and well it's sooo close to our apartment it's a must go. 

So why is this not a 5 star review? The decor leaves something to be desired as does the price tag and the sometimes cold although efficient service. In addition, most of the food is kind of mild and less complex in flavor than other places I've been to.

So why is this not a 3 star review? Our waitress left out the remaining half of our tandoori chicken from the to-go bag after we were done with our meal. I only realized this the next day when we wanted to dig into our leftovers. Figured I was screwed and there's no way this is getting fixed. Called the next day, and (although no one was friendly or apologetic) they asked me to bring over my receipt and they'd get a new tandoori chicken for me. And they did!! amazing!

Always yummy: garlic naan, veggie samosas, saag paneer, and tandoori chicken. :)
author: Acid B.

description: As a butter chicken connoisseur, this has been the best that I have had in the city (or maybe he bay area). If you're looking for a typical north Indian preparation of food, this is the place. They are very quick with delivery, haven't been to the place.
author: Neha M.

description:
The transformation that's taken place over the last few years at Indian Oven is remarkable. I haven't seen a restaurant so slowly slip into mediocre-to-poor food over such a long period of time.

You used to have saag paneer which was bright, creamy and full of taste. Now it's filled with oil and has no taste to speak of.

Their kormas used to have all sorts of cool sweet and spicy notes but now they're just a bomb of cream.

The flavor of everything--even the rice--has just bottomed out. This place is now just a shadow of what it used to be. The caliber of food coming out now is equal to your average random Indian restaurant--and occasionally even worse. For these prices you should expect a whole lot more.
author: Paul C.

description: Great tasting.  Big portion (2 meals worth).  Delivery was easy and kind.  The online order thru Yelp was seamless.  Thanks!
author: Kyle M.

description: Update: Ordered delivery again. The meal was tasty and came quickly!  It's everything I would like to have in a delivery. Thank you.
author: Heather N.

description:
I couldn't decide whether to make this a 3-star or a 4-star review so it's probably a 3.5-er. You will definitely see a few pretty harsh reviews for Indian Oven. Yelp says 3 stars is "A-Ok" and that probably fits my experience well enough. It was okay. I would go back but I won't rush to do it.

I had the saag-mushroom, onion kulcha and a mango lassi. A couple other reviews have mentioned a lack of complexity in the flavors. I would agree with that. My saag-mushroom tasted just fine but it didn't make my palate do the happy dance. Just nothing interesting about the flavor. The onion kulcha was pretty good and the mango lassi was well made. Service was definitely very quick and courteous enough but kind of cold and mechanical. None of that would be a big deal if they didn't charge $23 for that meal. For that price you expect a little more I guess.

One review criticized the decor. I didn't get that one at all. I thought the decor was totally fine.
author: Mark G.

description: Wow, this place was delicious. We got the paneer jal frazi, paneer makanhi and garlic naan. The flavors were amazing and complex. The panner jal frazi had delicious ginger and garlic flavors. I didn't care for be lentil soup as it had limes in it. Love the atmosphere and location.
author: Nicole S.

description:
The Service:

I have went to this restaurant twice now and found the same level of service - very distant and cold. I don't know why, but the waiters are not well trained in restaurant service. After seeing "A Hundred-Foot Journey", I understood that there are differences in culture, such that the you'll expect a level of soul interaction rather than superficial service. This service was as if they wanted to hold their tongue, do their job and get you out of there as soon as they can. One waiter, a young fellow, was so quick to our table that as soon as my girlfriend had her plate empty, he wanted to clear it away. I insisted he won't, since I was still eating. 

The Food:

Apart from the service, the food was excellent. The garlic Naan is great with the Saag Mushrooms. We had two desserts, the rice pudding and coconut ice cream (both delightful for the soul). 

If you don't mind sketchy service and care more about good food, this is a place to eat!
author: Joel J.

description: Particularly flavorful creamy and delicately spiced sauces--loved hydrabadi chicken and chicken madras. Also, genuinely spiced chai--not just milky tea. You can't go wrong here.
author: D W.

description: Best garlic nan we've ever eaten...ever. The staff was very friendly. The food is great and they have lagunitas on tap for only four dollars. All around great place to eat, and we'll definitely be back.
author: J H.

description:
The service is terrible,  food was okay  We were sat promptly,  but we didn't get any menus,  or any recognition that we were at the table for over 10 minutes. 
When our server actually came by,  he made no attempt to greet us or even make eye contact with us. 
The couple sitting next to us asked for a cup of coffee and the server said it would take awhile.  20 minutes later as they were getting their check they asked about the coffee and the server said that there was no time to make it,  that they were busy. 
It wasn't that busy. 
We ordered a round of beers and after 15 minutes I asked where our drinks were.  After I asked about our drinks our server pretty much ignored us for the rest of the evening,  letting his co-workers pick up his slack. 

I ordered chicken Korma,  it was good. 
My SO had lamb,  which was very over cooked. 

If we go here again, I would order take out and anything but the lamb. 
If you're looking for a good dining experience this is not the place to go.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Wasn't too thrilled with the flavors or the experience.  Heard great things but my meal was plain.  Had the eggplant and it did nothing for my palate.  The side salad was huge and I wish the server would have said something.  I hardly ate it since it came out WITH my meal.  The stuffed nan was the best part which disappointed me.  
They didn't have the wine I ordered either.  Wouldn't go back.
author: T L.

description:
Quite Good:

I get Yellow Dal, Palak Paneer (although now I am vegan I would rather get Palak Mushroom). I request for Tava whole wheat roti which they very generously make just for me   if they make tava roti a menu item instead of a special item.. I will make it a 5 star rating (for everyone elses sake.. )
author: Nihit S.

description: This place has wonderful food, atmosphere and service.  Their Masala Chai is amazing!   I will be back again very soon.
author: Emily M.

description:
We tried to beat the lunch rush and placed our order around 11am. After over an hour wait, our food was delivered lukewarm and not great overall. Here's a rundown of the meal delivered from Indian Oven (233 Fillmore) which cost almost $50 that we ordered on Eat24. 
Chicken Tikka Masala: Pretty delicious but lukewarm.
Assorted Naan: Yummy but lukewarm.
Saag Paneer: Cheese was more pungent than usual and the dish overall did not taste very fresh.
Raita: Tasted like it had been left out of the fridge all night.
Salad: More than half of the lettuce/spinach was slimy and wilted. So bad we could only eat the three cucumber slices and two of the four overripe tomato slices. 
Probably won't order from here again. 
On a side note, the Eat24 app wouldn't allow us to give any thumbs down, only all thumbs up. Not cool.
author: Redloci R.

description:
A buddy and I gave this place a shot as its been around for ever.  Last time I went here was about 10 years ago but decided to go there on a lark last week.  

To keep it short, this place puts way more emphasis on their delivery and take out business then they do for seated customers.  We waited almost 2 hours for our food (along with everyone else who was seated) but watched BAGS of delivery head out like lightening.  It was amazingly frustrating to watch and brought several customers to a boiling point.  HANGRY people I can assure you.

We ordered Chicken Tiki Masala and it came with 4 pieces of small diced chicken and tasted like straight up like honey tomato sauce, eww.  We couldn't believe it, I thought it was a joke.  The Chicken Vindaloo we ordered good and was a decent portion but had ZERO kick.  Its supposed to be spicy like hellfire people. 

They charge 5.95 for rice, no biggy right?  The catch is that they multiply that order times the number of people who are in your party.  I watched this poor table with six people get served "rice for six" and sadly realized they had just spent upwards of 35 bucks on rice alone.  It's extremely deceitful and really pissed me off not to mention it probably cost them about 2 bucks to serve.

The wait staff is super nice, and they obviously hustle and did the did the best they could under terrible management.  My water glass was always full for the two hours I waited to eat.

The crazy wait time and uninspired food earned this place a LOW 2 stars.  Go elsewhere until they re-prioritize their fundamentals.
author: Anthony D.

description: It's unfortunate since I really liked (note, past tense) their food.  The WHOLE problem is the delivery service.  The first time we had problems, the delivery took almost 2 hours, by the time the food came, we'd made sandwiches and ate those instead since we tend to only eat one meal a day.  I always put in my orders early to give the restaurant a chance to do the cooking before their evening dinner rush but they just sit on it and then make a tardy delivery.  The second time we ordered, and we tend to order almost $100 worth of food alone, it not only took almost 2 hours to get to us cold, but the delivery guy wouldn't give me the food until I paid cash for it; since I'd ordered online and put the tab on my credit card, I wasn't going to pay a second time and nicely told him I'd already paid via credit card, he wanted cash before he'd give me the food (I mean, I didn't want to go through the whole credit adjustment thing with my card when the charge shows up on my bill, so time consuming and too much time being put on hold and all that mess--and if you're not taking credit orders, what are you doing collecting my credit info for then???).  So we stood there arguing civilly and I finally demanded that he call his place and clear this up--all the while my food is getting colder and the guy is being delayed in delivering everyone else's food.  He doesn't speak English well so I assume he doesn't understand what I'm telling him but he finally calls his place, he looks sheepish and then says something like "o, it's all good" shaking his hands in that "it's all taken care of" gesture and backs off to go to his car.  Yea, I had tip money but had decided he didn't deserve it; your delivery guy ought to know what's going on before he leaves to make deliveries.  The last time we ordered, which now is over a year ago, the delivery service was so bad; we had guests coming over (the food itself from one of these Clay Oven is so good) so I put in the order early to insure it'd be here on time, and we waited and waited and waited, I called twice and was assured the order was on the way, the third call they didn't pick up the phone for.  We finally decided to just go out to eat at some other Indian restaurant before everything closes for the night (it was raining, we had wanted to stay home and watch a movie with our friends).  The next day I called again to let them know I wasn't paying for food I never got and was told the driver didn't get an answer when he rang the bell (our bell doesn't work so there's no ringing involved and there's a big sign telling people to knock on the door since the bell doesn't work) SO THE DRIVER JUST LEFT THE BAG OF FOOD IN FRONT OF THE BUILDING.  Right, like that's ever a good idea.  Don't know if the guy delivered to the wrong place and left the food, or if he'd left a bag in front of our house and someone walked off with it; doesn't matter anyway since we never received it.  This is so unfortunate since we really loved the food we'd gotten before from this place and I don't mind dropping close to $100 for good food but I do want delivery made and made close to the time expected, I think I'm fair as far as allowing 1-2 hours for delivery alone but obviously this isn't enough for some places so I withdraw my favors.  BTW, there's another Clay Oven on Haight, has the exact same address (231), so I have no idea if this is an entirely different restaurant or not--if it's a different place, they REALLY ought to change their name.  Since both have the same name and address, we no longer order food from either place because of these screw ups.  I normally tip on delivery 25% or better as my punishment for being too lazy to go out and get food, but there are other places to eat and other places/people who do provide better customer services--a fact in San Francisco so do a better job!
author: Kai T.

description:
This place is incredible! We're new to town and have been amazed by the delicious Indian restaurants that we've encountered but the quality and service here were fabulous.

We came in for takeout wearing PJs and realized that it's actually a nice, candlelight restaurant with rose centerpieces inside. The man at the desk was very friendly nonetheless and was actually extremely accommodating.

While we waited, they brought us delicious chai tea without us even asking, and once we checked out, added a dessert to our meal!!

The food was incredible, not only was the tea great, the dessert and chicken tikka masala were flavorful and absolutely delicious. I would give the food alone 5 stars, but the whole place deserves 5 stars as well.!
author: Paula G.

description:
I have been to this place couple of times.
It used to be great for several years but I guess the management has changed now. The food is just very average and the service is ok.
I won't go back anytime soon.
author: Sean A.

description:
Just The Best!! Walked All The Way Up Height To Fillmore and found this Jem!! Service was fast and so nice!!! 
My brother lives in the area so I'm happy to have a local dinner!! 
Great Food, good price, great Service!!
author: Conor M.

description: Best Indian food in SF. The service is great as well as their accommodations to vegan requests. The food is flavorful and very delicious! Would highly recommend
author: Campbell R.

description:
While I love Indian food, I'm also very selective - services, kitchen cleanliness, more than just the food.

Indian Oven has outdone it. The 2nd time I ordered food to go from them, I was an hour late (errand ran longer than expected), and when I got there, I discovered they were re-making everything, because of their commitment to the tastiness and freshness of food! Wow. And I didn't have to wait long, either.

The staff are courteous and I could feel they are genuine. They are nice because of who they are as people, not because they want my money. 

The food is thumbs down. I had it in the fridge for as long as 3 weeks - not recommending it to everyone here - and it didn't go bad. 

Next time when friends visit from out of town, I know where to take them!
author: Y L.

description:
This is a great date night place for Indian food.

Unlike some Indian restaurants, this has a clean atmosphere along with an enjoyable ambiance. We were served by Kuldeep who was attentive, friendly, and helpful (considering there are A LOT of choices on the menu :)

Order the Navartan Korma for vegetarian dish...so yummy! All the other staple dishes have been delicious.
author: Marie L.

description: Coming from the east coast, where great Indian food is hard to find, I was so pleased to have stumbled upon this places! Highly recommend!
author: Colleen R.

description: We stopped in here for dessert and some chai. They only have masala chai so we asked for hot water, cream and sugar to go with our kheer. Four different waiters came to our table and "took our order". I didn't realize kheer and water was so difficult. Eventually, they just told us they can't accommodate us so we left. I wish the first person had told us that. Never coming back here.
author: Zain H.

description: I stopped in about 2pm on a Sunday. It's pretty nice inside. You could make it a date, and wear nice clothing even. I ordered the Indian meat sampler plate. It came with tandoori chicken, lamb steak, and ground meat, served on a fresh salad. Two delicious dipping sauces were also at the table. Very tasty food. The wait staff wasn't particularly friendly, or non-friendly, they served me quickly, quietly, and kept my water filled up. But I could tell they didn't love me.
author: Shane N.

description: Indian Oven stands out for their exquisite food, great ambiance and fantastic service! We ordered their Samosas, Goat cheese naan, Onion naan, Chicken Tikka Masala, Lamb Vindaloo, and Basmati rice. The samosas were delicious and not greasy. The Goat cheese naan was ridiculous good. I highly recommend it! I loved devouring it with some of the Chicken Tikka Masala sauce. The Onion naan was good but not a stand out compared to the Goat cheese naan. The Chicken Tikka Masala was better than the lamb vindaloo.  The Basmati rice was fluffy, fragrant and perfect. I cannot wait to dine here again!
author: Caroline N.

description: This was an amazing place, with great food! The service was fast and good. The waiter was nice. Everything was reasonably priced. My family says you have to try the goat cheese naan. It was very good! Just make sure if you get the rice to get the right serving size. Overall it was AWESOME! Make sure to go here if you ever are in the area!
author: Tumbling G.

description:
Strike 1:
Food on the inside of my water glass. (No, it was not my backwash.)

Strike 2: 
I ordered the dressing on the side. Annndd it was all over the salad. I hadn't given up hope at this point- this isn't a big enough problem for me to send a salad back, its just annoying. 

Strike 3: (and this is the most important one)
2 bites into my salad, there was a 3 inch long black hair tucked under some lettuce on my plate. I'm a red head. That's when I gave up on Indian Oven. And I'm never going back.
author: Emily D.
