description: Good spot! Reasonable prices and quick/attentive service. Rice is extra but serves 2. Naan was so good and the chicken/lamb dishes were legit - good meat and solid portions. Will certainly go back as its closer to home.
author: PK R.

description:
Not sure what has happened since the last time I ate at Indian Oven, but last night's dinner was disappointing.  The service was great, and we went early enough that there wasn't a huge rush on the kitchen.  The food was just lackluster.

Samosas:  I think (as another reviewer mentioned), that these were frozen and then fried up.  While the outside was crunchy, the inside was bland and there were several parts  inside my samosa where I thought they had squirted sour cream or some sort of yogurt in the samosa.  But upon closer inspection, I realized it was uncooked dough.

Papadam: I think these are the oven baked ones, not the fried ones.  A bit stale, but not too bad.

Regular and garlic naan: Couldn't tell the difference between the two.  Thankfully, the portion wasn't huge like other places where there's enough leftover to feed a family of four.

We ordered the following main dishes, but nothing really special to talk about.  Saag Paneer; Lamb Biryani.; Chicken Korma.

I'm not sure I'll keep Indian Oven in rotation.  Seems like there are better places out there - cheaper, more expensive  - shrug - doesn't matter as long as the food is tasty.
author: Anonymouse C.

description: I'm here waiting for my food from the last 1 hour 20 mins..they just served us starters and when I Said I can't wait anymore and want the check..one comes up with a check and the other comes running to say that ur food is going to be ready in 3-5 mins..that time also passed and still they are not here... The appetizers that were served were not completely cooked they were just put in oil and given to us..I hated waiting and this is the worst wait time ever in any restaurant
author: Dinesh V.

description:
There was literally a piece of metal in my food. I have attached a picture of it in the restaurant pics.

Also, the next morning I felt horrible.

The food did taste good though but I prefer not dying by choking on a piece of metal or having indigestion..
author: Adam G.

description:
Seems like there is not a lot of good reviews, but my experience for a Friday lunch wasn't bad.  I was little skeptical that the place was pretty much empty when we got there around 1:30pm.  Needless to say, our service was great since they didn't have anyone else to serve except for 2 other tables.  

Food wise: we had their Spinach Paneer, Lamb with lentils, and garlic naan.  All very tasty and everything tasted fresh to me.  It was more on the spicy side, which I didn't mind at all.  Lets just say, I came out of there totally stuffed.  

Bottom line: I have been here a long time ago for dinners and I was always a fan, so I'm still a fan.  However, I think the prices are a little more on the pricey side for Indian food.
author: Meshell C.

description: Best Indian Food in San Francisco
author: Cathy H.

description:
Love this Indian restaurant and you should check it out. Service is great friendly and the food is excellent. 

Best chai in SF.
author: Pilar P.

description: Friendly staff. Nice interior.  Small space so you'd smell like Indian food after 5 mins of being in there!
author: J L.

description:
I have never written a bad review but today I cannot stop myself!
We ordered chicken biryani and chicken tikka kebab for delivery and both were really bad. The biryani had no taste at all, not even salt. It was no where near to what you call an indian chicken biryani. And the chicken tikka kebab had no indian seasoning used and was not even cooked through.  Worst experience of indian food I've had here.
author: Neha M.

description: Best Indian food in SF!! Best samosa EVER!!! Nice staff wonderful owner they stay open late and everything on the menu is fabulous!!!
author: Olivia W.

description:
I got panner makhani and paratta. I can definitely say that the panner makhani tasted nothing like panner makhani and definitely not worth $12. The sauce was very dilute and the chutney that came along with the order was very bad! We had it delivered and the delivery was over an hour late. 
On the whole, the experience wasn't good and I would not recommend it to anyone.
author: Maha L.

description:
I went here 10 years ago and loved it.   On a whim my wife and I decided to eat here on our way home.  We were the first people in the restaurant and the wait staff seemed to be bored out of their minds.   After we got our food the waiter and another just kept pacing around the restaurant desperately looking to do something.  While it's nice to feel waited on, being stalked while dining is not.   

The Tandoori Lamb and coconut curry prawns were the best of the dishes we ordered.  The lamb was a slightly too salty - and I like salty.   The prawns were rich and flavorful.

The bengain bharta was so bland it was useless.  The chicken in the tiki masala was leather tough and the sauce was just meh.  We ordered both garlic and chili naan and they also lacked flavor.  

Needless to say this place has gone way downhill.   We will not be back.
author: Jason H.

description: Excellent service, food and prices. I will return again and again. Location is convenient from the Grove B&B.
author: michelle h.

description: One of my favorite places. The chicken vindaloo is delicious and rich
author: Sean H.

description:
A-MAZING. Best Indian food I've ever had!

Food is so flavorful. One bite and the flavor pops in your mouth. My favorite is the chicken tikka masala. The naans are perfectly crisp.  The garlic naan mmmmm.

The environment is cozy and inviting with Indian music playing. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive.  My water never got down to half a glass. 

Highly recommend. Will come back everytime I'm in the city!
author: Sonia R.

description:
This place used to be great but has gone way downhill. For the second time I ordered chicken vindaloo and requested white meat only. I confirmed it on the phone and it was written on my order, but when I arrived home (20 minutes away) it was all dark meat. This is the second time in a row that happened. Very frustrating to get home and realize the order was wrong especially when I don't live close by. I called and the guy said they would re-do it and I could pick it up...they didn't even offer to deliver for the inconvenience. 

The food is also very inconsistent. Sometimes it's good but other times it was greasy and the chicken is sitting in a pool of grease.
author: Sarah S.

description: This was some of the best Indian food I've had in the United States... It was delicately spiced, light on the stomach, and definitely cooked with lots of love. I got the coconut curried prawns which were excellent, and tasted the pakoras, paneer bhurji (amazing), and dal... Norman (I think that's his name) the owner was so sweet, he sat and chatted with us even though we closed it down on a Saturday night after Kirtan. If you are looking for a very clean, beautifully decorated (with Indian murals done by a talented local artist) and with lovely service - please go here! End your meal with a fresh coconut ice cream and cardamom infused rice pudding that literally takes you back to the motherland... A perfect experience, a fantastic restaurant. Thank you Indian Oven!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
You win some and you lose some.  With Indian Oven, I lost.  There was very little to recommend.

1.  Review for delivery from Indian Oven.
2.  Ordering was easy via Grubhub.com
3.  Chicken Vindaloo -  It was only luke-warm.  Compared to other Indian restaurants, the portion was small.  The sauce was very watery and had little flavor.  The potatoes were undercooked.

http://tinyurl.com/47z25z6

4.  Vegetable Samosa - It was cold.  The shell was soft.  It lacked the crispiness that great samosas have.  The flavor was ok.  The texture of the filling was just right.  
5.  Rice - It was cold and slightly hard.
6.  Garlic Naan - It was also cold and had large burnt spots on the bottom side.
7.  It is overpriced.  The total was $32.63.  This was for one appetizer, one entree, one order of naan, and 3 cans of Coke.  The exact same order at Urban Curry costs $26.24.
8.  Delivery was prompt but did take an hour.  The delivery person was polite and professional.
9.  I requested a paper plate. They did not bring one with the delivery. 
10.  If Indian restaurants provided fortune cookies, my would read: "One should see another restaurant to find your nourishment."
author: Mark D.

description:
Ordered take-out from their website.

Chicken Tikka Masala was a bit watery and flavour was 5/10.
Paneer Makhani was extremely watery and had barely no flavour.

Prices were also higher than normal.

Never again.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Disappointed again!!!. why do i have such high expectations from Indian food places here in SF, because I am always comparing to food I eat in India, this place sucks!!!!
What amazes me is we Indians have such good grasp on spices, and how we use them, but for some reason when we start cooking for non Indians, we feel the need to hold back, maybe we are underestimating our understanding of how non Indians handle spices.
I say cook food that is real and authentic to your culture, and people will folk...this place is as unauthentic, and bland as they get...if with a strong Indian palate, and/or enjoy spices, stay away!!!!
ps:  Prices way toooooooooooo high!
author: BOSHIKA T.

description:
Great service and amazing food. The best mango lassi I've had in a long time.

I highly recommend it.
author: Ac K.

description: Really wanted to like this place, but truthfully the food was kind if bland.  It wasn't bad, but not really good enough for me to order again.
author: Daniel A.

description:
Beautiful looking restaurant, the food was okay. 

I ordered over the phone (went and picked it up) 1 Samosas, 1 Chicken Korma (med. spicy) and 1 Naan. Came up to $22. Back to my hotel room, open the bag ...where's the rice?? I'm use to Indian restaurants giving rice alongside my order, did I have to ask? was that extra, whatever, thinking I'm hungry and will know next time.

It worked out, used my Naan to get the sauce of the Chicken Korma. It was a light nice dish, chicken cooked, enjoyed it. The whole meal was filling, have no complaints about it.
author: Brian R.

description: I got Lamb Tikka Masala, the meat was so over cooked it was very chewy.  Nothing worse than leather tough meat :(  Will make sure to order from other places in the neighborhood next time.
author: Nirea S.

description:
Man, what a let down.

The food did not taste Indian - it tasted Italian and like BBQ, which others have mentioned. They really nickel and dime you too - we paid $6 for rice, $2 for papadum and $4 for naan. And they served room temperature white wine which was unusual. As many have said, food was bland, too expensive and not very different than the $2 bottle of curry we buy from Trader Joes. Major bummer.
author: Ben W.

description: Love this joint.  Classy.  Always get extra naan and saag and chicken tikka masala.  The white table cloths are a nice touch.  The food isn't greasy.
author: Kerri K.

description:
It makes me really sad to write this, because I used to love Indian Oven. I just ordered delivery, and the food was pretty much inedible. The butter chicken was watery and completely flavorless. The eggplant had a weird taste, and the raita was sour. 

Basically tried it and then threw everything away. 

What happened, Indian Oven?
author: kathy c.

description:
Ordered delivery here and let's just say that I've never had such a terrible Indian food experience in my life. 

I'm not sure how it's possible to have BLAND indian food, but the rockstar team over @ Indian Oven managed to exceed even my lowest expectations and produce food that was essentially tasteless. Additionally, to be clear, adding a ton of chile oil or trying to make food super spicy does not mean the food has flavor, it usually means you are over compensating for a subpar product.

We ordered Tikka Masala, Sag Paneer, Lamb Vindaloo and some Garlic Naan.

Tikka Masala - incredibly bland, almost no flavor other than tomatoes and the sauce was incredibly runny and oily. The sauce didn't stick to the meat and essentially was like an out of the can gravy from the grocery store.

Saag Paneer - The cheese cubes were incredibly firm, almost as if they had been spoiled. The cheeese was as hard as a rock, even inside of the deep spinach based sauce.  The spinach sauce was also runny like the masala. Lots of oil and again a blandness that made me think the Indian Oven guys have never heard of spices / herbs to season food.

Finally the Vindaloo was ok. Nothing to write home about, but again, there was a distinct lack of flavor in the dish.

The final kicker for this experience was the price. $55 dollars for 3 dishes and a Naan. For 1 star food and delivery, this is a highway robbery act that MUST BE STOPPED.

I wouldn't go back if they paid me.
author: Justin O.

description:
I enjoyed their pakoras and punjabi chai. I felt at home, and loved the ambiance.

The Kashmiri chicken was recommended to me since it had spinach, adding to that I doubled my spinach fiesta with the Spinach Parontha.

I  was also entertained with a complitary yellow lentil, or 'yellow dal" which was awesome, it was made in a totally new fashion. The lentil grain hwas soft and smoot still holdg down to its circular shape. It was individually defined.

I loved the whole experience, I was really feeling the heat of the oven, the tastes overwhelming my mouth. And to add to their wonderful customer service, was a good bang farewell: they brought to our table Keer or rice pudding. Which I felt was also lightly sweet yet nutriently definite. The portions were also healthily distributed. Quality took priority and hosts were particularly concerned on individualistic customer service.

Overall: Goodjob!
author: International S.

description:
One of my friends asked her friend at work, what she thought the best Indian restaurant in the city is. Indian Oven was the answer, so she had me take her there. And ever since, when I'm in the mood for Indian food, or I want to introduce someone to this kind of food, this is the place I go.

Indian Oven isn't cheap. It isn't way over priced; it's a little more per item than their competitors. It's simply that when I start ordering, I can't stop ordering different things because there are so many different tastes I want to try.

I've been there multiple times, and I've ordered online thru Seamless multiple times, and I'm always happy with the food. If you eat there, it can get very loud on the main floor when they're busy. If you're looking for quiet, they have an upstairs private party room that is much quieter; if it's not being used for an event, ask to be seated there. If you order delivery, please note it can take around 1-1/2 hrs, so order early.

A few dishes I love:

samosas; mulligatawny or dal soup; chicken tikka masala; saag paneer; paneer tikka korma; kashmiri biryani; lamb biryani; naan - garlic, onion, kabuli, keema (lamb).

Now I'm hungry.

- Adam
author: Adam M.

description:
Friendly service. Small but cozy restaurant. I'm sure they can host a party in the upper level.

Samosas were excellent! Chicken tikka Masala was amazing. They really mean spicy, which I love!

Highly recommended it, especially since the kitchen staff is 100% Indian. 

I can't wait to go back!
author: J. C.

description:
I ordered delivery from here and it's the best Indian food I've had in the city!

I placed my order a little late (9pm) and thought it would take awhile since I ordered lamb chops, but it was to my door in about half an hour! The delivery guy was really friendly. He called to let me know when he was 2 minutes away, and was extremely appreciative for the tip. 

I ordered lamb chops, bengan and rice. Everything was fresh and flavorful. The lamb chops were exceptional - tender, juicy and perfect flavoring. I'd come back just for this dish!

5 stars for the great food and service.
author: Sonya P.

description: The quality of the chicken is terrible. Ordered the Murgh Makhani (butter chicken) lots of cartilage and bone. The flavour was meh. Overpriced rice. Bland Samosas. The samosa sauce was good though.
author: Emma M.

description: The goat cheese Nan was ridiculous delicious.  We ordered several curry dishes our first time...but forgot to order rice.  It would be really nice if rice automatically came with the dishes. ...charge more that's totally ok.  We would still definitely order from them again and again.
author: Jason F.

description:
Terrible tasting food; extremely slow. No easy customer feedback mechanisms. 

delivery arrived cold and 40 minutes late. But that stuff happens & it wouldn't have been a problem if the restaurant had handled it properly (given a partial or full refund). The bigger problem, however, was the food.  I ordered to dishes and they were hands down the worst food I've had since moving to San Francisco. Entirely too much turmeric in both dishes I ordered, giving the dishes a bitter taste. The spice proportions were way off (something I'd expect from someone who not only has never cooked indian food before, but from someone who also didn't read the proportion recommendations in the recipe). Unfortunately, I didn't find an easy way to contact the managers to give feedback before posting on YELP...maybe the chef was out sick and another employee filled in?
author: Sandy J.

description:
"how you like i f**k you in the a** you [n-word]?" that is exactly what the manager asked/(told?) me in broken english when i called to inquire about my order.  you can't cite me for it.  it's a quote.  

i can't believe i'm forced to write this review but when i told others what happened they insisted that i let everyone know.  

my buzzer wasn't working.  i got told this after getting scolded and refused both my food and a refund.  so i called grubhub.  i was pretty upset.  i told the woman what The Manager told me.  she said she would call the restaurant and call me back.  i figured i'm never seeing my money or the food again because he's just going to deny it.  i get a call back from a manager at grubhub and she seems pretty shaken up.  she apologized profusely and insisted that i write this review on their site after giving me a refund and additional credit.  it turns out the manager was even more rude to the grubhub manager and she wouldn't say what he said but referenced that a few "f-bombs" were dropped. 

i've ordered from here probably over 20 times, it was getting to be weekly.  it was exorbitantly overpriced and ok but but much better than other places in sf that i tried that were pretty oily.

if you're looking for mediocre indian food in sf, there are plenty of other places.

if you're looking for threats of getting sodomized and racial slurs getting tossed your way, then look no further than india oven, sf.

needless to say, i won't be ordering again.

at some point (about an hour after the phone call) they must have realized they had done wrong because they showed up my house and called repeatedly, refusing to leave for 20 minutes.  i had already been issued a refund and didn't bother answering the calls or the door because i couldn't imagine what a classy joint could pull out of their hat.  they should really be shut down.
author: Jason Z.

description: Absolutely delicious food (we have takeout), but for the price and portion size, I think I'll buy elsewhere.
author: Darren P.

description:
I guess really 1.5 stars. I recently moved to SF, and this was my first Indian food experience in the city, unfortunately. We ordered delivery - it arrived promptly, and the rice (while not included with entrees) and naan were fine. The entrees, however, were very sub par. The chicken tikka masala did not taste like chicken tikka masala - it had a smoky, almost barbecue like flavor. It was like a thin, oddly colored gravy. It had some heat, but it was really bland. The chicken saag at least was recognizable as saag, but it was equally bland.

We were really bummed. Even average Indian food is pretty tasty, and this was well below average.
author: Julie I.

description:
This restaurant was recommended to me by my physical therapist at CPMC so, after my session today, I met a friend, who lives in the area, for lunch.  I was impressed with the setting, quite lovely, clean, paintings depicting Indian ladies and scenes.  The menu was quite extensive though a bit expensive. 

Since it was 2PM, there was only one other small group dining.  My friend and I shared a very good calamari pakora, saag aloo - a delicious spinch and potato dish, and lamb jalfrezi - this was supposed to be lamb with mixed vegetables but I found this disappointing as the only vegetables I noted were onions and red peppers.  I was not especially impressed with their garlic naan.  Papadam was served with the meal, along with an assortment of condiments.  

We had a nice bottle of Rabbit Ridge Central Coast estate Zinfandel, reasonbly priced at $36.

Service was good but, of course, there was only one other table occupied besides ours.

All in all, for lunch, I think I much prefer the buffet at Indian Clay Oven on Clement Street, far more reasonably priced, many choices, nice setting.
author: Carmen H.

description:
This was crappy, dammit!  Culinarily lazy and culturally questionable.  

I'm mad at Indian Oven because I don't like to flame restaurants.  Anyway, FLAME ON...

It was our first visit. We eat and cook indian a lot.

The room was nice - brighter in decor and lighting than most Indian places. The guys were nice.

Food:
aloo gobi - flat. whatever. 

saag paneer - reddish color to it? Makes one wonder if it's the spinach or the cheese that was red.  Not very good, but passable. 

chicken tikka masala - also discolored, like a bright, day-glow orange. tasted fine, but not like tikka masala.  

veggie korma - also discolored and watered consistency.  Looked exactly like a watered down ranch dressing. Soupy at best. 100% awful by any measure. Shameful. 

nan - well, the bread was fine. Score!

This is a wheel-less lunch van, basically. If you go there, start SMALL and cautiously advance until you catch any whiff of discolored or watery sauces. That is how you'll know.
author: Kevin A.

description: What a wonderful neighborhood restaurant. Food is fresh and delicious and the service is super attentive. Great experience, overall! Thank you.
author: Sand M.

description:
What happened to this SF institution? This used to be above and beyond the best Indian food anywhere. I lived in SF for 8 years and this was a place for special occasions. Not sure what happened since.

I came here for lunch and the rice was dry and crunchy, the paneer makhani was bland. Other more casual Indian places in SF like Chutney beat this hands down now. What happened?
author: M E.

description:
We ordered delivery from Indian Oven via grubhub.com, and it was the first time we'd tried their food.  First, the good: the order arrived promptly and was delivered by a friendly man. We ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Vindaloo along with rice and naan. 

Now the bad: I love spicy food, and it's pretty much impossible to make something too spicy for me, but Indian Oven succeeded. Neither I nor my partner could finish what we'd put on our plates, our mouths were burning beyond belief. I ended up drinking orange soda to try to ease the pain, which helped. But really, this food was unnecessarily spicy beyond the palate of 99.9% of people. It was physically painful to eat. I still have the leftovers in the fridge and will probably end up dumping them rather than subjecting myself to that abuse again. 

There were no options given for heat level at the time of ordering; if Indian Oven likes to make their food with the fires of Diablo, I suggest they add options for mild/medium/hot so that diners can choose.  Until/unless they do, I suggest that anyone wanting to take a chance on this place take the initiative to specify your desired heat level, because otherwise you may end up with some very expensive and inedible food.

I took off 3 stars for the food being inedibly spicy, even to a spicy food aficionado.  I took off another star because the prices were quite high.  All in all, a waste of $45.
author: David T.

description: Good food, good service and they even gave us a complimentary rice pudding with cardamom. Super nice people...And close to our apartment. We will be back.
author: H. M.

description: The food has been on a serious decline in the past year or so. This place was legendary for great food up until about 6 years ago and then the food began a steady decline and more recently it seems they have no interest in making quality, flavorful food at all. It was always a bit expensive for Indian and the portions were always smaller than other Indian restaurants but the food was that good, you over looked those things. We have ordered delivery about 6+ times over the last year (always hoping it was just an off day the last time) and it has been "meh"- bland or worse. Tonight was the topper- ordered the Chick Tikka Masala, it was watery, really watery and flavorless and the Lamb Rogan Josh was filled with grease, we had to dump about 4 Tablespoons out before we could serve it. I mentioned the decline of food quality, and they mumbled something about the "chef returned to India for awhile, but he's back now"- nope, the chef has lost it (they have lost the chef, perhaps), Indian Oven is no longer a contender. We have now found our replacement "go to" for Indian on Market St (delivers to the Upper Haight)- however they are closed on Monday which led us to give Indian Oven one more try and our last. I seldom write reviews, but this needed to be said- hoping they turn it around again, until then...
author: M M.

description:
I just ate my indian food from INDIAN OVEN SF and in one of the last bites there was a piece of SHARP METAL.
are you kidding me??
author: c.love n.

description:
I have to agree with another review that this must be Indian food for people that don't actually know anything about Indian food. Really very bland and overall just WRONG.

I really wanted to like this place. So much so that I actually kept ordering new dishes when the ones we originally ordered came out and were terrible (5 dishes in total for 2 people!). The food was impressively bland and oddly floral-smelling considering the total absence flavor. I think it would be difficult to make food that tasted more like nothing.

If you are super duper white, have no taste buds and actually hate Indian food maybe you'll like this place.  

If anyone knows of a great Indian place in SF, I'd love to hear about it. This place was beyond disappointing.
author: Kelly S.

description: The Indian food here is good.  This is coming from someone who grew up with authentic Indian (Punjabi) food, and these guys know what they are doing.  The restaurant is clean, and service is quick and friendly.  Also if you like Bhangra music, you will enjoy the background music.  They have quite a selection for vegetarians and non vegetarians.  I'm a picky eater, and always comparing to my own cooking, and I would give them 6 stars of it was possible.  Prices are comparable to other restaurants in the area.
author: Farheen M.

description:
While on the hunt for Indian food, we came across Indian Oven. We initially expected it to be a typical casual dining spot, but upon walking in, we were a bit taken aback by the nice white tablecloths, cloth napkins, and fancy layouts. Suspecting it to be finer dining than we were looking for, we got a table and perused the menu. Sure enough, this wasn't no Naan and Curry joint and the debate came up to find something a bit cheaper. But to be honest, I've not had "fancy" Indian food yet, so I figured let's give it a shot.

We went through the menu, asked a few questions, then placed our order: paneer tikka masala for me and tandoori chicken for him, along with a side of rice and garlic naan. The food took a bit longer to come out than you would aim for a more casual establishment, but as I said, this place was quite a bit fancier than a $7 plate of Indian food.

My tikka masala came out in a dish, chunks of paneer floating in a light orange creamy sauce. The rice and naan came out at the same time, and within a minute, this incredibly loud, hissing, steaming plate of chicken with veggies was delivered. Just the presentation of the tandoori made me boggle. We jumped into our meal with enthusiasm!

The tikka masala was great, very smooth, delicate, and the flavours were subtle. I'll confess, it wasn't the best I've had, as the one I'm in love with has a strong tomato flavour which this one lacked, but it definitely stood out as different and well done. Paired up with some rice and naan, I ate as much as I could.

The winner of lunch though was the tandoori chicken. The charred bits didn't take over the individual pieces of boneless chicken but there was enough to make it delicious. I can't actually say how it tasted, since I didn't partake of any but given my friend's absolute joy over his meal, I'd have to say it was a hit. The meat fell apart under his fork, requiring no knife to cut it, and the lack of bones meant he had five juicy pieces of chicken to partake of. 

The overall cost of the meal wasn't bad when compared to the quality of the food and the fine dining experience we had, but this isn't a place to go if you're looking for a cheap $12 lunch out. On the other hand though, if you're looking for some high quality Indian food, you can't miss out if you try this.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Awesome foooooood!!!! I've been here many times and never get tired! It's one of the best indian places in SF. Try the lambs and the breads. Highly recommended.
author: Eddie L.

description: A fine choice for a rainy Friday evening. Only the onion kulcha was disappointing (quite soggy; wrapped in foil which trapped too much moisture, I guess). Saag gosht could have had more lamb, but if you must have creamed spinach this is the way to do it. Mulligatawny soup was tasty and gone in an instant!
author: Henry M.

description: The food is tasty but I think it is expensive for the quantity. I ordered a pick up and the food was ready in 20 minutes. The Chicken Makhani (Butter Chicken) is delicious.
author: Harshal J.

description:
One of my worst dining experiences in recent memory.

It is too bad - this place used to be quite good.  My friends and I were trying to get into Maven around the corner but decided that a 90 min wait was just too long so we stopped by this place.  I've been here a number of times in the past and never had any complaints - the food has been quite good, actually.  However, the last time was a couple of years ago - how much could have changed?  Turns out EVERYTHING had changed.

I asked for a table for five, and was told there would be no wait.  Strangely, half the tables were empty although somewhat disheveled.  It took the wait staff 10 mins to straighten a table out and seat us - whatever, no big deal.

After another ten mins later and no attention from the wait staff, we finally managed to flag someone down to order five samosa and a tandoori platter to start and order the rest of our food.  Twenty mins go by before they manage to serve us samosa - but only three.  Ten more mins for the next two, and no tandoori platter to be seen.  Turns out they served that to the wrong table, took it back, and then tried to serve it cold to us.  Then the rest of our order came, painfully slow and one dish at a time.  Worst part, it was all bland, under-spiced, and with rubbery meat.

When the check finally arrived, to add insult to injury, they overcharged us for a dish that we ordered but they never served.  I have never been to a restaurant as poorly run as this place - I'm pretty sure these guys are in charge: http://bit.ly/iSb94V

Stay away.
author: Naeem I.

description:
I ate here on Friday May 2nd hoping to eat some yummy began Indian cuisine. 

After discussing the menu with a server, and explaining that I am a vegan, it took over 10 minutes to make a healthy and yummy meal that had protein. I will say their vegetarian menu looks amazing...but many of them either had cream in them or lacked protein.

When my veggie pakora arrived I quickly found it to be flavorless. I used some of the green dipping sauce to season it. Half way into my appetizer a server comes over and says, "Sir, that sauce has yogurt in it." 

Disgusted I sent it back and waited for my main course. It was watery, lacked flavor, but had a lot of veggies and garbanzo beans. Hence why I still gave them 2 stars.

I cannot recommend this restaurant for vegans, but I think vegetarians and omnivores will enjoy it. Great dining atmosphere, clean, etc.
author: Nate T.

description: I've been coming here for years and the food is some of the best Indian around. And very authentic chai! Definitely a nice place to go with friends or family. I've always found the staff to be friendly and helpful... I was just there for lunch and had a really nice server named Sunny. Great spot!
author: Peter N.

description:
I really wanted to like Indian Oven. Reviews seemed okay enough and it's close enough to my place that I could have a go-to Indian takeout set. However, this place really disappoints. 

I ordered the naan, chicken saagwala and rice. The naan is decent, but the chicken saagwala was really a let down--it was incredibly bland. The spinach part of it was overall lacking the proper flavor and cohesiveness, with big chunks of tomato and onion that were still not cooked properly (onions were therefore crunchy.) That is definitely not how it's supposed to taste. The rice was honestly the best part, and sadly, that is the one item I could have made at home if I wasn't so lazy. 

To be honest, I wouldn't mind the mediocrity of this place if it was priced accordingly. But they're charging $3 for a naan and $3 for rice (I guess throwing 5 peas on top makes it a fancy dish,) and $13-$14 for the curry. Personally, those prices increase my expectations and sadly, Indian Oven did not meet them.
author: Ari R.

description: I've ordered most of their lamb dishes and chicken dishes. Oh and they have great curry. I enjoy everything I order and they have good customer service.
author: Demi W.

description: Fanfriggintastic Indian food! We've lived in SF for over 3 years now and tried many an Indian food restaurant in search for THE ONE. I'm happy to share with the Yelp world that we have officially found our go-to place! We ordered online for pickup and they were speedy and friendly. The amazing smell that enveloped us in the car made it close to impossible to wait till we got home (we did, though) and we were so happy with the reward that came!
author: Hayley T.

description: We came to SF for the weekend and this was our favorite dinner for entire trip.  The waitress helped us order since were unfamiliar with Indian cuisine.  Great options here for vegetarians. There were staff dedicated to pouring water and they would not let my glass go past half full.  We'll be back next time we're in SF.
author: Bill L.

description:
I really had high hopes for this dinner. It has been awhile since I had Indian food. I was looking forward to it.  I had eaten here before but a few years ago.  What a waste of $100.00 on a New Year's dinner. 

The food was bland and unsalted. The Prawn Vindaloo wasn't spicy. The Chicken Korma dish was off as well as the Saag Paneer.  We had all had these dishes before and we were trying to re-live our memories of good Indian food we had consumed in the past.  My party was left  sadly disappointed.

The coup de grace of my Indian Oven experience was the service. The waiter was nervous, inexperienced, or clumsy, maybe all three but he managed to launch a bottle of Taj Mahal beer and break a pint glass. The beer and glass landed on my friend. Beer and glass everywhere. They did not comp us a dam thing. That is just rude. I will never ever go back here.
author: Infodiva B.

description: Me and my family have been coming here for years. Had a friend visiting town who didn't think he liked Indian food. Because it's my favorite food on the planet I had to show him how wrong he was and I wanted to pick somewhere that would blow his mind. Indian oven did not disappoint! The Kashmiri chicken was amazing with the cilantro in it, garlic naan always a must and everyone loved the lamb vindaloo! Also.. Their chai tea is the best I've ever had!!!! Obsessed
author: Andrea K.

description: My experience for the 1st Indian food was a 4 star. Food was great! I'm an outgoing guy so I'll make my own experience anywhere. If you're looking for a great neighborhood vibe for Indian food this is it. Enjoy!
author: JR T.

description:
It's been a long day and I am extremely tired.  I look through yelp for a restaurant that delivers.  Great, I find this place.

I placed my order and checked the time for it to come at 8:45.  Since this was my first time ordering online/for delivery through eat24, i decided to check my order status at 8:15.  The customer rep told me that the driver just left with the food.  I was definitely looking forward to some yummy indian food.  15-20 minutes pass and I just wait, my time slot was 8:45, so I wasn't too upset.  Then came 9pm, and still no food!  I decide to call at 9:10 and they said the driver is on his way.  It doesn't take that long to get here.  He says they will be here in 3-4 minutes.  it was about another 10 minutes until my food came.  

Now i get to chow down!  I ordered chicken vindaloo and murgh makhani along with 3 orders of naan.  for the price, i expected a lot more.  The portions were very small...but that wasn't the worse part.  Both dishes were extremely bland!  There was no flavor (how can that be in indian food!?).  And on top of it all, my food was cold (what do you expect - it took forever to deliver....) 

I would not recommend for anyone to eat here.  As expensive as it is here (I spent $40 for yucky food), I was better off going to a much better restaurant.
author: Corinna L.

description: Really like the food here, it's kind of a turn and burn restaurant though at busy times. Guy gave us serious shade for not ordering rice. But...food is really good so I'll continue to come here.
author: Nicki C.

description: Either I've eaten here too many times or the food has lost some of its flavor. Rice had odd metallic flavor, saag paneer, bhindi masala, chicken tandoori meh. Bengal bhartha yum.
author: Rosalee R.

description:
Worst delivery experience and Indian food experience EVER.

I ordered Indian Oven through GrubHub after going back and forth of whether I wanted delivery for dinner. Total mistake.

Projected delivery time was 7:11pm. The time comes and goes and still no food. At 7:40pm, I contacted a GrubHub rep to figure out what was going on and they informed me that Indian Oven was backed up but had my order out for delivery. 

At 8:25pm, 45 minutes after my order was supposed to arrive, I still don't have my food. By now I am pissed. FINALLY by 8:35pm, the food arrives.  

What pissed me off even more is that the food I got was handled so poorly than the curry had spilled all over the rest of my food! Not only was the food a mess, but they also MESSED UP my order. The rice order was supposed to be Pulao but they gave me regular Basmati rice instead. And don't get me started on flavor and ingredients. What was left of my Lamb Madras Curry was bland and had no traces of raisins. My Kabuli Naan was stuff with something, but it definitely wasn't fruit. 


For the $25 buck minimum order for delivery, I would expect more. I would never order from here again! This is the worst Indian food experience I have ever had in my entire life!
author: Beck P.

description:
I came here for an early dinner with my sister. It was about 5:15, and the place was empty. The server who took our order seemed impatient, and after we each said what dish we wanted (Paneer Jalfrezi and Vegetable Jalfrezi), he said "Naan and rice for both of you?" and started writing it down before we answered, as if it was a given that we would want both of those. Then, one of the dishes we were served was not what we had ordered (we got Paneer Tikka instead of Paneer Jalfrezi). I asked him to make sure it was Paneer Jalfrezi because the appearance was not what I had expected (did not match the description on the menu), and also because my sister's Vegetable Jalfrezi had actual vegetables in it whereas my "Jalfrezi" was not vegetables but rather an orange sauce. He then disappeared to the back of the restaurant and did not reappear for about 20 minutes. Once I got home I looked up Paneer Jalfrezi online, and I definitely got the wrong thing -- cubes of paneer cheese in a creamy orange sauce, rather than paneer with vegetables!!
The Paneer Tikka was good for what it was, and the garlic naan was decent. However, I got the feeling our service was not appreciated, and between the poor ordering experience and receiving the wrong dish (though the server "confirmed" that I'd received the right thing), I will not be returning to Indian Oven. I love Indian food and there are many better places to get it for this price in the Bay Area.
author: Rachel F.

description: Best Indian food in town, and maybe because they don't charge haute cuisine prices, somehow this place doesn't have as many 5 star ratings as it should. Fantastic food, reasonable prices and great service. After 21 years in SF,this is my favorite Indian food restaurant.
author: Kurt S.

description: Wow, my gf and I have had Indian food all over Northern California and found this place to be simply fresh and delicious! The peas are fresh not from a can and the basic rice is richly flavored with simple spices. The tika masala was truly mild for mild. And when the check came asking for military discount awarded us with free kheer. Simply fantastic!
author: Sergio V.

description:
Food was 5 stars. Exactly what I was jonesing for.

Service was 0 stars. (5 + 0) / 2 = 2.5

Went late on a Sunday night. Restaurant was about half full and we were seated immediately. That's when the "immediacy" stopped. Dinner took well over two hours with no appetizers and no dessert.

Every single time we wanted to talk to the waiter I had to ask the guy who filled water to send him over. I sat for 30 minutes with an empty beer before I went to the bar myself to ask for another. The gentleman that was at the bar told me he'd bring it to me. But of course, he didn't. I had to wait until he was just standing around and then gave him a "hey, where's my beer?" look.

It was ridiculous.
author: Joel B.

description: When I first moved to this neighborhood a decade ago this was the Indian restaurant to go to in the area, possibly in the whole city. What a change 10 years can make. It has gone from a go to high end place to mediocre take out, at best. The overall quality and flavor of the food has gone steeply downhill.
author: Patrick M.

description: Ordered from them for the first time tonight. Really good Kashmiri chicken. The sag paneer was a little on the bland side but the food came as promised and the delivery guy was nice. Will order again for sure.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Wow... was the place ever a disappointment. This place is supposedly one of the better Indian restaurants in the city which baffles me...

1) The pappadum was undercooked
2) The mulligatwany soup was bland
3) The chicken tikka was off
4) The service was mediocre
5) The food was wayyyyy overpriced for what we got.


I am seriously stunned... maybe you might enjoy this if you aren't familiar with Indian cuisine but for a person who eats Indian food 4x a week at least, this place was just not cuttin it. I will not return. 


Oh yea... the chai was wayyyyyyy to sweet. Typically you aren't supposed to sweeten chai as you let the customer add how much sugar they would like.
author: Marlee S.

description: Reliably good indian food. There are some interesting flavor combinations, like the apricots in the Hyderabadi chicken and the coconut-raisin chicken Madras.
author: Niels ..

description: For one who doesn't usually like Indian, this place was awesome! The whole experience was lovely. It was a perfectly tempered evening and we were strolling when we decided to eat here. There were a couple groups sitting outside...the inside was empty. A man (I think the owner) graciously approached us and offered inside and outside seating. We asked for outside and within a minute, 3 different staff members had carried a table, chairs, tablecloth, and silverware and set everything up for our enjoyment! We sat at the corner of the alley and Fillmore, so my view was a picturesque one of SF homes up a hill. We got papadum (which I've decided I want to have access to for snacking all the time, they're really tasty), a couple beers, Kashmiri Chicken, Saag Gosht and Garlic Naan (we passed on rice). The service was very nice and friendly, and the timing was relatively quick but in a good way. The garlic naan was well seasoned and baked fluffy. The chicken had a yummy buttery sauce. Both dishes had plenty of meat in them (thumbs up!). The lamb and spinach sauce was equally delicious. We wiped both dishes clean and stuffed ourselves to the brim  (happily!). The dessert menu looked delicious, though we didn't have room for much else. The owner was so very sweet though, and brought a scoop of house made ice cream for us to share! it was a delightful blend of flavors....flower blossom, pistachios, almond, coconut, I don't even know. it was very good! Additionally, the staff was all so friendly, helpful, and all around pleasant. We will definitely be coming back! I'm very picky about my Indian food and this restaurant was great! Thank you!
author: Zara S.

description: Coming from the East Coast, where good Indian food is hard to find, I was so happy to have stumbled upon this place! It was some of the best Indian food I have ever had! Highly recommended!
author: Colleen R.

description: Excellent food. Chicken Tiki Masala, Calamari  appetizers were delicious. Nice atmosphere. Polite and attentive waiters. We'll be back! Best part they are open later than most-- I believe we arrive a little after 10pm.
author: Nathan R.

description: We just finished lunch at Indian Oven and had a great experience. We we especially impressed with our waiter Sunny who was extremely pleasant and helpful with any question we had. The garlic naan was great and the lamb dish I had was fantastic. We're from out of town but if I lived here I'd come regularly!
author: Ryan P.

description: Such a great neighborhood spot! They sat us immediately for a big group, quick service and accommodating for those who came late or left early, and the food was delicious. Also the surprise birthday celebration for our friend was perfect!
author: Michaela Y.

description: LOVE this place. Having traveled through India, I can say it is my favorite in SF. We are regulars who just discovered the "Indian oven experience" - a great deal for papadum, raita, chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken and lamb, rice, naan and dessert! Just add Kingfisher and you can eat a great meal in a pretty restaurant for around $50! (You can go much less of course but my hubby is a growing boy!)
author: Michelle R.

description: Really good food, attentive waiters, and nice atmosphere. The prices are reasonable for the quality, but I wouldn't say this place is cheap. Their delivery is pretty on point as well.
author: Tim R.

description: Very impressed. I had a curry and my companion had a soup and another entre. Everything was delicious. The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. The bathroom was clean, and the entire atmosphere of the place was pleasant and well-taken care of. We even were lucky enough to receive a complimentary dessert dish, which we both, although already stuffed from the generous portions, loved!
author: Anastasiya B.

description: Eat here at lunch time!  I had a vegetarian thali lunch the other day- everything was perfect and it was the best deal in the neighborhood.  and it offered me a moment of peace and quiet being off haight st.
author: Devon W.

description: The flavors were there but the execution was not great. Everything was really dry. The rice, the chicken. Again the flavor was good, but the food wasn't cooked quite right.
author: Grace P.

description:
Service is slow, food isn't fresh.

Would recommend passing this place up. The service took forever (we got the impression they brought my main course before they had even put in the order for my b's meal - even if this wasn't true, this is how it seemed). After we had handed over our credit cards to pay, it took them ~15 minutes to get back to us.

My biggest complaint was the food, though. I ordered a salad. Nothing in there was fresh. It was if the cucumbers had been drained or they were simply dried out. There were some rotten spots on them. 

I won't go again. I remain pretty loyal to Aslam's in the Mission - it's the best Indian / Pakistani food I've found in the city.
author: Helen D.

description:
This place is "loved on yelp" and zagat rated...? Really? 
I guess it might be good for SF indian? Maybe? Sadly, I live in the South Bay and realize this place is crap.

I had chicken tikka masala here, and the cream in it was slightly curdled. Tasted a bit like cheap tomato sauce. The chicken was totally dry and overcooked. The chai was way too sweet, but to their credit, they actually brewed me a sugar-free chai. That's maybe why I'm not giving them 1 star.
author: Sasha W.

description: This is my all-around favorite Indian restaurant in San Francisco, and my automatic go-to place with friends and visitors. Great Murgh Makhani and Bindhi Masala, and a myriad of delicious varieties of breads.
author: Sharman G.

description: Delicious dinner!!!  Great service, mouth watering entrees, delightful ambience. The management even brought us complimentary tea and wine..... What's not to love?
author: Char H.

description:
The Worst wait service and the longest wait for food in the 10 years of going to IO. With no apparent excuse, because the restaurant was half empty. 
We won't be back any time soon, the experience was that bad and no apologies or discounts for the shitty service. 
We had to repeatedly ask other personnel about our food and never really had the attention of our waiter who would disappear and resurface just to ignore us. The Most bizarre restaurant experience in a very long time. It's like they collectively forgot how and what to do as a restaurant for their patrons. 
We ordered samosas, which is pretty standard,  but we had to inquire  after a half an hour and to our surprise they were served undercooked and cold and without sauce. When we received the new order, they too were served without sauces and when sauces were provided no serving utensils given, Wtf! Just One screw up after the next. 
The main dishes finally came out after having to be made twice, because the first set sat so long they went cold and had to be remade. Where's the rice, again like they completely forgot what they were doing. The rice finally came out and again to our surprise, was undercooked and that to had to be sent back. I could only shake my head at this point and say, how is this possible, they can't even get the rice thing down, even though it's a standard for any Indian restaurant...
Good luck with your business Indian oven. We won't be back any time soon.
author: M G.

description: I'm a SF native and this is my favorite Indian food spot in the city. Love their garlic naan, and (classics I know) their chicken tikka masala and saag paneer. Balanced flavors, generous portions, attentive service and bang for your buck.
author: Sarah F.

description: My local Indian joint. Consistently very good. Very attentive service if you dine-in, or easy takeout. Their doors are always open.
author: Howard S.

description: Just got my order delivered via Eat24. Super fast delivery and food tasts heavenly! Fresh, hot and very tasty! Super creamy Tikka Masala and Korma, with very tender and juicy chicken. Rice is fluffy and very flavorful. I'm impressed!
author: Laurie P.

description: Love this place!!!! I've been to Indian Oven several times over the past 8 months-ish and have been really happy with every experience. My favorite dish is the chicken biryani, though I just had a vegetable curry and it was delicious as well. Tonight the owner/manager brought us over a complimentary dish of homemade coconut ice cream, which you should definitely try when you go here. It was so creamy with a refreshing coconut (duh) flavor. The service is fantastic as well and they pour giant glasses of wine. Go here the next time you're craving Indian!
author: Sydney L.

description:
Ordered chicken tikki masala, potato saag, pickles, and pakoras through GrubHub. I wanted to love this place because of all the positive reviews on GrubHub and because the server a) looked like a Bollywood actor and b) was super friendly and awesome. Unfortunately, my dreams of a Bollywood-style dance sequence happening on my tastebuds were left unfulfilled. 

The chicken tikki masala had what I can only describe as an "off" taste. My husband said it tasted like tomato soup with lots of charcoal in it. The chunks of chicken were very large and when I bit into one it was grey in the middle. I could not eat much of this dish.

The potato saag was truly devoid of flavor. I make saag regularly because I love it, so this was a big disappointment for me. It had zero spices that I could identify, including salt. Thankfully, I got the pickles which were SO salty that no human could eat them unless smothered in mounds of unsalted spinach goo. So, that problem solved itself.

Lastly, the pakora were the style that remind me of the sweet and sour chicken on a Chinese buffet - really smooth and puffy and not thin and stuck to the shape of the vegetable. I don't know what the difference is in technique (wet batter vs. dry?), but I know that I prefer the latter. The sauces that came with the pakora were flavorful and interesting.

My search for the perfect Indian delivery continues!
author: Emily S.

description: The food was good. Had a variety and was all tasty. The service was less than ideal. Was a slow night with far more staff than customers but we experienced delays and wait staff didn't seem particularly concerned with serving our table until we left when he asked us several times to review them on Yelp. If they want to improve their ratings, they should try improving their service.
author: Mary F.

description: I ate here only once about 5 years ago and am happy to say I have never been back. The Food was mediocre at best. It lacked flavor and was definitely not fresh. It all had that leftover taste to it and the temperatures suggested that it had gone for a ride in the microwave before arriving at my table. I understand that South Asian food is time consuming and complicated to make but, there is no excuse for serving me yesterday's leftovers. Regardless, I never went back and even though the menu has much of what I love on it, I refuse to order it from them. I'll just cook it myself.
author: Aabid K.

description:
We just missed a huge group leaving so the gentleman I was with and I didn't have to wait at all....which was great because we just had a beer at the Toronado and were plenty hungry.

It was all pretty yummy, the chef Sunday night had it down.

* IF you venture here, definitely get the spinach paratha - it was perfect.

* The tikka masala was rockin (this particular night) and I do compare to others since I can't seem to go to an Indian establishment and not order this.  I will not steer you wrong. But I also understand they have more than 1 chef thus the inconsistencies. 

* We also split the chicken vindaloo which was good not great. Do NOT ask for it medium spicy though, they don't mess around!

Generous portions, we didn't finish it all.

The only thing serving as a major negative: the service was really off - almost weird by certain male server/busser.  His mannerisms were seriously awkward. Not that it really matters, but this is SF, not some village.  I think they thought I was some North Indian chick and perhaps they were wondering why I was with the white boy.  ha x3 . We laughed it off but still, strange. 
 
3-4 stars for the food.  If this review was for the service, it'd be a solid 2 at best.
Thus the average, in case you care, since you probably do because nobody is forcing you to read my review ;)
author: Athena S.

description: Underrated indian place. The goat cheese naan is worth trying. While you're not going to find anything new or creative here, it's all well prepared and solidly executed.
author: A.J. T.

description: I lived behind here for a while, so it was a default option if we couldn't decide where else to go. I like the pakora here.
author: Fiona T.

description:
Hmmm, kinda conflicted about Indian Oven. While remaining a fan, the price / value equation seems to make less and less sense. 

Environ:  A little crowded, kinda like how many tables can we fit in here

Food: always reliable:

Bhindi Masala (fried Okra) if you are an Okra fan, this is great

Tandoori: the chicken, the prawns Great.

Drinks: Mango Lassi, is the best 

Lamb Vindaloo: could be called vodoo hot, but very tasty. Lamb at Indian Oven can be a bit tough.

Naan: like the garlic w/ cilentro, hey its Naan, nothing fancy but prepared at the right temp - hot.

Dal Saag: - spinach w/ lentils - liked it but it is a little too soupy. 

Service: is fine, mostly attentive, only used one flare to get more water.

Price: well, for a nice environ, reliable food, good service maybe it is ok, for a quickie Indian encounter... maybe not. 

Overall, if you are lookin for a cheap Indian dinner...not the place. Reliable, clean and cooked to order ... yes.  (not scooped out of the $ 5 buffet like some other Indian food joints).Big amount of food for a small price.... not your place. Consistent food quality, good service, I do recommend Indian Oven..
author: Matsuo U.

description: Super disappointed in a delivery order last week. I honestly couldn't even finish it. LIterally *WATERY* curry. I'd never seen anything like it before, and hope never to see it again. It's a shame because I'm a neighbor and I order a lot of food. Oh well!
author: Matthew S.

description: Dropped by with family and friends. Ambience was pleasant, not too casual and not too formal. Food was excellent. Service was very friendly. I was about to get a parking ticket for my car and the owner alerted me and prevented the ticket!
author: Suchit J.

description: This place was delicious. We had the most fun waiter who showed us true Punjab love and hosting. Come eat here, you will not regret it!
author: Julia V.

description:
I used to really like this restaurant. Then last night we got food poisoning from their food. 

Food poisoning is horrible, sickest I have ever been in my life and despite having had good meals at Indian Oven over the last several years I will never ever risk eating there again.
author: lisa g.

description: I love this place. Tandoori fish was succulent, seasoned perfectly. Garlic naan to make you wanna slap your momma, and a lamb vindaloo that was rich and just beautifully prepared. I've visited Indian Oven many times and have yet to be disappointed. Actually that's an understatement: this is some of the best Indian food I've had anywhere.
author: Jack K.

description:
A friend had told me about this place awhile ago, but when my physical therapist raved about it, saying they served the best Chicken Tikka Masala he's ever had, I made a point to try this place out. Here's the rundown:

Location: It's right on Fillmore in Lower Haight, which is perfect for some grub before bar hopping or even just a good spot to grab dinner in general!

Venue: This is a nice place. White table clothes, white napkins, candles, and rustic Indian artwork... Don't worry, it's still casual enough to get away with jeans and a hoodie -- just don't go in looking all scrubby! It's a small place, but they've strategically laid out the tables to optimize their space. On a late Monday night, the place was busy, but we didn't have to wait for a table for 2. It's well lit and can get a little loud just from all the chatter at nearby tables, but you don't have to yell to be heard by the rest of your party.

Food: We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala (of course) and Bombay Chicken (I think that's what it was...). Instead of rice, we just got some Garlic Naan and Goat Cheese Naan. Our food came out in about 10 minutes or so, but before then, we were served an couple sheets of a crispy thin bread (almost like a cracker, but thinner) and four different toppings. One was a sweet jelly, two of them were more of a liquid consistency and were slightly spicy, and the last one had some solid pieces in there, but I still have no idea what it was.  When our food came out, they set the Chicken Tikka Masala over the little candle, which I thought was cool. It was made to hold the small serving dish and I guess it was supposed to help keep it warm. The Bombay Chicken was just served in an oblong container, no frills. The Tikka Masala was delicious! The chunks of chicken breast were still moist, and the sauce was flavorful. I scooped up the sauce with my Garlic Naan for a tasty treat. The Bombay Chicken was also pretty good, although it didn't contain those nice chunks of white chicken breast meat -- instead it was more variable pieces of meat with the skin still attached on. It did have a nice kick, which I appreciated since I love spicy food. I wasn't a big fan of the Goat Cheese Naan, though. Maybe because I'm not a huge fan of goat cheese to begin with, but one small slice was enough and then I just stuck to the Garlic Naan.

Cost: For our two dishes, Garlic Naan, and Goat Cheese Naan, our total was about $40. Kind of pricey, but we did have some leftovers. I might come back again just because it's  great location and it's good food with great service. However, I'll have to try out some other places for their Chicken Tikka Masala before claiming it's the best.

Looking for tasty Indian food? Check this place out!
author: Leana L.

description: My wife and I give it 5 stars for nostalgia as much as the quality of the food (which remains excellent, by the way!). We lived in the Lower Haight from 2005-2009 and Indian Oven was our standby, especially the navratan korma which is made differently here than at any other Indian restaurant we've been at. After a few years hiatus from the 'hood, we returned tonight for a great meal. They've apparently changed ownership at least a a few times in the past couple of years but somehow the navratan korma is very much the same as always - delicious!
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Really excellent flavors and freshness, we've been extremely happy here most of the time.  We highly recommend starting with Samosas, then going with the Navratan Korma and a Saag (spinach) of your choice, side it all with some Chapati or Naan, then finishing off with a Kheer (rice pudding) that is usually rich with spices and cardamon...delicious.

We've only been disappointed here once, when they were exceptionally busy, put us in a corner upstairs, gave us cold rice, and made us wait for nearly an hour to get it.  I'd say if they look overwhelmingly busy, head to Squat and Gobble next door.  Otherwise, stay for some excellent Indian.
author: Adam A.

description: This place is simply amazing. Staff is great, food is awesome and very good presentation. This restaurant is a must in San Francisco.
author: Sneider M.

description: Did not send rice and was extremely rude.  Very unpleasant after an hour wait. They are terrible and I will never order from them again. Food is poor quality and service is horrible.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Very good!!! Really great sauces and the tandoori chicken is very good. I would definitely come back here!!
author: Ted G.

description: Great food, great attitude. I'll definitely be coming back! The murals are exquisite, the staff is phenomenal, love it!
author: Peter S.

description: Lovely, warm, authentic atmosphere, and the food was fantastic. The service was friendly and generally fantastic.
author: Peter W.

description: Seriously awesome Indian food.  I had the Kashmiri chicken tonight and it was top-notch.  What puts these guys in a league of their own is the service, which is kind and knowledgeable.
author: David P.

description: The food and service were amazing and Sunny our sever was impeccable, he even made us  a popper salted lassi which is not from the region they specialize in, as well as not on the menu.
author: Jared S.

description: The food is great, and probably better than in nearby Tandoor on Haight. The place is small and really packed, so when it is full it really feels like someone is sitting in your lap. They should really reduce the number of tables at that place.
author: Igor P.

description: Amazing and friendly service. Always refilling your water and chai tea. And they always give us complimentary rice pudding at the end of our meal. Great food. Try the lamb pasanda curry with ground cashews!
author: Matt E.

description: Nice portions and great service. The curries we had were all pretty tasty but didn't stand out against the greater morass of indian food in SF. still i liked our varieties of naan and their spinach is nice and rich.
author: Misha T.

description: Meh. This place is decent. The service is ok. The food is fine but nothing to rave about.
author: R. J.

description: The food is mediocre at best. First the guy on the phone had an attitude when we were ordering, second they didn't give us not even one napkin nor did they provide utensils. Third the chicken was frozen or refrigerated from prior days and thrown in the microwave, why do I say that because my chicken tandoori was lukewarm and when I bit into it the bone was refrigerator cold so I know that I they did not cook it fresh I paid for fresh food not refrigerated or frozen food. They threw two cut up chicken pieces of chicken  tandoori in a small to go box with a bunch of raw vegetables. The chicken Masala had a slight off taste to it as if it were getting old. The chicken curry was as far as the sauce was delicious but even though the chicken looked cooked and was in fact tender I couldn't help but to get a slight undercooked chicken taste in my mouth. So an order of chicken masala, chicken curry, 2 orders of chicken tandoori and 2 orders of chewy garlic naan with two tiny half filled sauce containers cost us 59.99 when it should have been 43.00 plus tax. Never will order from them again
author: Maria L.

description:
Burnt half cooked tandoori rotis.  One dish completely bland, one undercooked and other with a mix of spices so unbalanced to make you gag.  Not one saving grace for the food delivers from Indian oven last night.

This used to be my go to Indian restaurant in the city 10 years ago.  Our food experience (delivered) yesterday led me to sign up on Yelp to write my first review ever.  Really unfortunate that it had to be a negative one.  4 star prices for 1 star food.
author: Rishi D.

description: The Pulao rice had no peas, unlike their description.  They also only delivered 1 order of rice instead of 3; He had transcribed it onto his own receipt and typed a 1 instead.  It was stapled on the bag.  How did you not think 1 rice for three entrees was strange and then not double check the order?
author: Jacob A.

description: I've been going to Indian Oven for 20 years. Still the best Indian food in SF! The chef has changed and I think the food has gotten even better. When does that happen? When I went for my birthday, they blasted some awesome Bollywood music for me. It was awesome. The service is great. Very friendly people. Old time SF fave. Go there and get a Taj Mahal with your dinner. You won't be sorry.
author: Kristin T.

description:
Me and Indian Oven go way back. I had my 20th birthday party there, in the upstairs section.

Now I live in walking distance to the place and have recently eaten in and taken out. Both times, I have been extremely happy about the quality and quantity of the food I've received.

Don't miss the:
goat cheese naan
aloo gobhi saag
author: Miriam W.

description:
I have friend who once dated a guy a group of us dubbed Maursleezio- Maurecio if you are reading that is you.  We called him this (not to his face) because he toyed unmercifully with our friend.  One day he would tell her that he could picture how their kids would look.  "They would be so cute."  And the next he would tell her how he hooked up with some other chick... which per his logic was okay because hey- it was just sex, it didn't really mean anything.  Eventually Maursleezio's picture was taped to the top of our garbage can and it was doctored so that he was doing something lewd (rhymes with mojob) that I can't mention on yelp.

I have only done takeout from India Oven.  And sometimes the food is specfrickintacular.  But sometimes it's not.  India Oven's bad days are not remotely in competition with Maursleezio's.  He's in a category by himself.  But I certainly feel toyed with at times.  My mouth starts watering at the thought of Indian food.  I get out my menu and make the call.  Stomach starts growling.  I hightail it there and back, practically running up the Fillmore hill to my house.  Once home I can't get the packages opened fast enough.   Sometimes I am more than pleased.  The five star days.  And sometimes I feel like they cheated on me.  

Volatility.
author: Cort T.

description: Ugh.  What happened to this place? It be used to excellent.  Tonight was pretty lousy- everything was flavorless, lackluster and straight up disappointing.  Masala- thin and tasteless, paneer blah.  Never again!
author: R G.

description:
Tandori chicken was quite good. How do Indian restaurants make that rice? I really want to know. Its so not mushy.

Service was fine. There were a few small things that, well, I don't know. I gotta go with 3 starts on this.  In fairness, I wish I had gotten a curry dish. How else can one really tell about the quality of the restaurant?

There were about 30 menu selections for those who do not eat meat. They seem to do a big carry out business.

I've been exploring this neighborhood. I like it. I didn't seek Yelp help for this selection. Gotta live on the edge occasionally.
author: J T.

description:
Meh.  Terribly unimpressive Indian food.  The samosas were okay, but the naan was either stale or just oddly thick, while the shrimp korma was terribly un-korma like (and the sauce was really, disgustingly thin).

It was edible, and the delivery was fast enough, but I won't "go back."
author: Jillian Y.

description: Others have noted the same thing: what HAS happened here? I used to live in the neighborhood and this place used to be packed with lines outside. The food was always delicious. Not anymore. Now my past two visits have been so disappointing. Chicken vindaloo so overcooked. Lamb with tough pieces, shrimps like rubbery curls. Only the naan was good. Sadly have to admit a favorite restaurant is now barely mediocre.
author: Rob N.

description:
Here's another restaurant that I've decided to review seven years after the fact so you should take my review with a grain of salt. Thankfully on Yelp there is no voting button like on Amazon where you can mark a review as "not helpful."

This place was all upscaled-out with a wait on a weekend night. After all the hype about this place having the best Indian food in San Francisco, I thought our chicken tikka masala, naan, and the rest were good, but not great. I wondered if the raving reviews were really due to this place looking all yuppified.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Hubby and I went there for dinner last night and we had a great time.  We orderd the dinner for two option and got a lot of great food.  My favorite was the chicken tika masala.

A great place for date night:)
author: Rebecca P.

description: Loved it, food was great, very attractive restaurant. Wait staff was very good about receiving feedback on their service and were friendly.
author: David R.

description:
The owner wrote a responsive and considerate letter to my comments. I want to revise what I said: I don't believe this restaurant "ever" serves leftovers...again, that's what comes to mind the day after Thanksgiving (it's a back handed "American" compliment...kind of like not the full Monty like Thanksgiving, but leftovers are part of the holiday experience and usually also good!) 
Anyway, I've decided I'll return to this restuarant because of the owners immediate attention, politeness, and clearly from the other Yelps...this man cares about doing a good job! If I could erase the other Yelp, I would because again, anyone could have an off day. Thank you Indian Oven for caring about your customer satisfaction and contacting me through Yelp!
author: M. M.

description: Fresh, quality ingredients, and a sensible range of mild to spicy options for any dish. The veggies in my chicken jalfrezi  were crisp and yet well seasoned. Plenty of rice in one large carton to divide between two dishes. Some dishes such as the saags and the bangan are pureed to a fine smooth paste, which doesn't suit me, but the flavor is still well rounded. Delivery service was timely and courteous.
author: Drew W.

description:
Not the greatest indian around but fine for being my neighborhood Go-To.  The goat cheese Naan is really good.  The service is pretty good and the staff are generally friendly.

Definitely choose this place over Tandoor on Haight
author: Tom L.

description: I was hesitant to order form here because of so many negative reviews, but my regular place was closed so I decided to give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised! It is a great quality for the price and I will definitely order from here again. The delivery was about 15 minutes later that GrubHub predicted, but they threw in a free kheer so I got over it real quick.
author: Julie F.

description: Went on a date here and had a nice four top near the window with no wait (at 7 pm). Good beers for four bucks and calamari for app. It was less breaded than other calamari I've had before, but very good. Had chicken and spinach dish with extra spice, garlic naan and rice. Way too much food which I love. On the occasion, I left nothing for the homeless. Two people ordered flaming dishes of meat and veggies. WHEN I go back, I'll be asking for that. Server wasn't super inviting to our menu questions, else it gets my five.
author: Tim L.

description:
very pleased with fish tikka masala & chicken mukhani.

well blended and perfectly spiced :)
author: SF U.

description:
PLEASE NOTE THIS PLACE CHANGED OWNERSHIP JUNE 4, 2010. (at least that is the date they told me, it has been a couple of months since I have been here)

NOT AS GOOD AS IT USED TO BE!!!!

I used to love this place. The food was great, the service was great but then they sold the place. The new food is now mediocre, the service was poor, and the prices, menus and outfits the same. I hate to have to say this but for the price there is MUCH better Indian Food in the city especially for the price. I am so sad I want to cry that I have lost another one of my favorite restaurants.
author: Denise L.

description:
Pretty fancy Indian restaurant. The decor was pretty, place was clean. We came here for lunch since we saw that it was poppin' for dinner.

I ordered the chicken tikka masala. I was disappointed that you had to pay for naan... it should've been free. I asked our waiter if all naan cost the same and he said yes. Yeah... my garlic one was a dollar more than the regular naan, thanks. The chicken tikka masala was okay. Oh, rice doesn't come with the dish... you'd have to pay separate too. So I took the curry home.

The portions were okay... rice and free naan would've made the experience better. I'll stick to Delhi Kitchen in SD... free naan, two massive portions, salad, all for $7.
author: Laura F.

description: Love thier food it is so awesome im about to order food from then now getting Tikka Masala my favorite
author: L B.

description: I wanted to like this place so much, because it is right in my neighborhood and I've heard great things about it, but unfortunately it was a disappointment. We had the dal soup, the meat platter, chicken korma, and saag paneer. Everything was ok, but definitely not great. Underspiced for sure - for example I ordered the chicken korma medium spicy but it was less than mild. Everything just tasted far too bland. The service was also underwhelming, from the timing of the food as it came out to the speed with which we got a second drink. And it was a quiet night, not at all busy. Will I give it another chance some day - maybe, because it is right near by and I will say the Naan was done just right. But I wouldn't recommend it to anyone looking for a fantastic Indian meal.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I've only done take out here so I can't judge this off service or ambiance so this review is strictly for food. 

We ordered the aloo ghobi and asked for it to be extra spicy and they certainly delivered. I loved the tenderness of cauliflower and potatoes that paired well with garlic naan. 

Speaking of garlic naan, have you had kulcha yet? It's soft bread stuffed with onions, potatoes or paneer for the brave of souls. Now pair that with chicken vindaloo and you have the kind of breath that reeks of fire for the rest of the night. I wouldn't kiss anyone after eating this but maybe you could find someone to share this with you and neither would care about those side effects.
author: Jessica K.

description:
It got cold and windy on Fillmore and from the outside this restaurant looked lovely and warm, so my partner and I went in. The atmosphere is quite nice, for such a small restaurant they are definitely making the effort to be fancy.

I thought the menu was priced a bit high, but looked past it at first. As I ordered an entree and had to pay extra for rice and naan (those not cheap either) I was thinking the food must be good and abundant.

Here's what went wrong: the staff, trying to be classy, but couldn't get the orders straight. The prices, would be fine if the food was more/better, but in this case out of line with quantity and quality. The restaurant, nice solid furniture and decorations, but midway through our meal the very strange music got louder and louder until my husband and I looked at each and said at the same time "let's get out of here!". The service, we never received the thin cracker and sauce appetizer (the name is slipping my mind at the moment) we watched the other tables get. THE FOOD, most importantly, thin watery sauce and just barely an excuse for the entree listed on the menu. The naan was the worst I've ever seen and for the very first time in my Indian-eating experience I couldn't even get myself to finish it.

Every Indian place I've ever eaten (and that includes the very unclassy ones, e.g. Naan-n-curry style or worse) has had better food! Don't go here! Save yourself some money too. There are too many other options in SF.
